Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from children's television programmes take part. This edition features CBBC presenters Anthea Turner and Andy Crane, CBeebies stars Justin Fletcher and Gemma Hunt, children's TV hosts Dave Benson-Phillips and Gareth Jones, and former presenters Sally James and Geoffrey Hayes. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-host Richard Osman has all the answers.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, with Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The whole world has fallen under the sway of a mass delusion, and it seems only Bill Potts can see through it. Even the Doctor is unable to comprehend the truth, meaning it is up to Bill to set the record straight by persuading her friend that humanity is in deadly danger. But a Time Lord's conviction is not easily broken, and with the fate of an entire species on the line, if Bill cannot get the Doctor on-side, she may find herself forced to kill him. Sci-fi drama, with Pearl Mackie, Peter Capaldi and Matt Lucas and guest star Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Elle agrees to deliver a career talk at her son Blake's school, but her speech is derailed when she discovers some unexpected truths about her child and his friends. Luckily, Josh and Jacob are on hand to help. Medical drama, starring Jaye Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes becomes concerned when Dermot announces he wants to ask his childhood friend Buster, a known criminal, to be his best man. However, she is distracted when her neighbour Winnie's husband is rushed to hospital, leaving her son trying to raise funds for his wedding by getting embroiled in a money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: Clique
programme.desc: Faced with proof of the darkness at the heart of the world she and Georgia have entered, Holly faces a dilemma. Unable to turn to Rory, she instead seeks advice from a new group of friends, who conspire with her to drag the truth out into the light of day. Doing so will bring the world crashing down around those who thought themselves unassailable, but also serve as a point of no return for Holly.(n)

programme.title: Clique
programme.desc: Tensions have escalated to a fatal degree, forcing Holly to ally herself with Rachel. All the hidden secrets of Solasta and the clique now seem to have been revealed, and Holly finds herself doubting every choice she has made throughout her first term. However, as Holly seeks to bring Georgia back from the brink, there is one last truth to be revealed, one that connects to her own past. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: A teenage loner wakes up one morning to find a classmate passed out drunk on her lawn. They form an unlikely friendship, and he offers her help in constructing a new persona for herself that will boost her confidence - but begins to fall in love with the act she is putting on. Drama based on the novel by Tim Tharp, starring Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley and Brie Larson.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Pentecost
programme.sub-title: Pentecost with the Archbishop of Canterbury.
programme.desc: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby leads a live service from Holy Trinity Church, Folkestone. Songs and hymns include O Happy Day, How Great Thou Art, and 10,000 Reasons.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott is at Westpoint Exeter, where two teams battle against one another and the clock to find three items to make a profit at auction. Guiding the teams around the antiques fair are experts Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: The One Show presenter Alex Jones and business journalist Steph McGovern take on a mission to help families change the way they shop without changing their lifestyles. They begin in Glasgow, where Colin and Karen Rodger dream of taking their three sets of twins abroad for the first time. However, they are big spenders, with Karen's shoe addiction rubbing off onto the children, while Colin opts for only the very best when it comes to gadgets. To help them save money, they have their branded products replaced with substitutes, and also test cheaper vacuums and washing detergents. Will they be able to change their spendthrift ways?.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby presents an episode celebrating the golden jubilee of Liverpool's Metropolitan Cathedral, and meets two of the parishioners. Plus, music to mark the feast of Pentecost.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison report from Essex, visiting a restored oyster boat, a nature reserve for dragonflies, and a colony of common seals, and meeting people who build racing rowing boats. Steve Brown learns to fire a medieval longbow, Tom Heap reports on environmental damage caused by spoil heaps, and Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith meet a contender for Countryfile's Young Farmer Award.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby presents a Leaders' Special Question Time with Tim Farron of the Liberal Democrats, and First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the SNP.(n)

programme.title: One Love Manchester Concert
programme.desc: Live coverage of the benefit concert from Old Trafford cricket ground in Manchester, organised to raise money for those affected by last month's Manchester bombing. The stellar line-up includes Ariana Grande, Take That, Katy Perry, Justin Bieber, Coldplay, Pharrell and Usher, with proceeds going to the We Love Manchester emergency fund.(n)

programme.title: Election Questions
programme.desc: Green Party co-leader Jonathan Bartley and UKIP leader Paul Nuttall discuss the key issues of the general election and answer questions from a studio audience. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Election Questions
programme.desc: Leanne Wood, leader of Plaid Cymru, discusses the key issues of the election with a studio audience. Presented by Bethan Rhys Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Heart of the British Isles - A Grand Tour.
programme.desc: The presenters take a tour of the Irish Sea, visiting every country in the British Isles. Alice Roberts receives tips for surviving quicksand in Morecambe Bay, Mark Horton observes the remains of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's final work in Liverpool, and Nicholas Crane discovers why Anglesey is the site of some of Britain's biggest earthquakes.(n)

programme.title: Never a Dull Moment
programme.desc: A songwriter living in New York falls in love with a widowed ranch owner, and hastily marries him. However, she finds adapting to country living far from her glamorous Manhattan roots proves difficult, as does winning the acceptance of her stepchildren. Romantic comedy, with Irene Dunne, Fred MacMurray and Natalie Wood.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye, Mr Chips
programme.desc: A kindly Latin teacher leads a simple life at an English boarding school, until he finds his life made happier and more complicated when he falls in love while on a walking holiday. His newfound bliss is shattered as he is forced to deal with his former pupils being killed in the First World War. Period drama based on James Hilton's novel, starring an Oscar-winning Robert Donat, with Greer Garson and Paul Henreid.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Hebridean Escape
programme.desc: The marine biologist follows the Bonnie Prince Charlie route on horseback as he writes a guide book to a series of trails around the islands. He also takes part in an anti-erosion project on Vatersay, and visits Benbecula, where he joins a hedgehog patrol, before attending the last lamb sales of the year and organising a beach clean-up.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties in Liverpool, Stoke and London to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Scotland prepare starters, with returning chefs Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battling it out with newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. All three contenders take huge risks, with Ally making a ricotta that should take 24 hours to prepare, Michael attempting to impress with a vegan dish and Angela intriguing her fellow contestants with a savoury ice-cream dish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath creates an inventive fish dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed. Meanwhile, Angela Malik takes on the ancient skill of preparing sashimi, and defending regional winner Michael Bremner uses turbot for his meal, but which will impress the veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: An insight into the life of one of Hollywood's best-loved actresses, telling the story of her Oscar-winning career by using rarely seen archive footage of her appearances on the BBC.(n)

programme.title: Ivanhoe
programme.desc: A brave knight defies his father and enlists the help of a rich man and his daughter to rescue Richard the Lionheart from imprisonment. Along the way they also have to counter the machinations of tyrannical Prince John, who is determined their quest will fail. Medieval adventure based on Walter Scott's novel, starring Robert Taylor, Elizabeth Taylor, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders and Guy Rolfe.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Sea Otters - A Million Dollar Baby.
programme.desc: Following the life of a sea otter pup growing up on the coast of California, in an unusual location among the yachts of a marina. Its mother must teach her baby how to avoid the boats and find food in the busy harbour, but an attack by a tough male otter signals disaster for the family. Narrated by Bonnie Greer.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Blackpool Tower Circus, where expert James Lewis discovers terracotta tomb figures that could be more than 1,000 years old. Plus, Anita Manning examines a collection of seaside postcards, and Paul explores the Morecambe Winter Gardens - one of Lancashire's most famous theatres.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Grow Your Own
programme.desc: Town residents are outraged when a refugee family is given space on their allotments to help rehabilitate a traumatised father - but both groups unite in a common cause when a mobile phone company plans to build a mast in the area. Comedy drama, starring Benedict Wong, Philip Jackson, Omid Djalili and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: The Lake District: A Wild Year
programme.desc: For the wildlife and people who live amid the stunning scenery of the Lake District, life is one of continuous change. This documentary features cutting-edge camera techniques offering a new and unique perspective on a turbulent year in the life of England's largest national park. Time-lapse photography shows months and weeks passing in seconds - snow and ice giving way to sunshine or the frequent rain showers - while the animals, plants and people find extraordinary ways to cope with the challenges of this ancient landscape. Narrated by Bernard Cribbins.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring and his platoon are put in charge of manning an observation post on a derelict pier, but they are marooned when their boat drifts away. Warden Hodges spots their signal light and rows out to tell them to switch it off, but his boat sinks and he is stranded with them. Comedy first broadcast in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: The Sapphires
programme.desc: An Irish music manager discovers four Aboriginal Australian singers in a remote mission in the 1960s, and plans to turn them into their country's answer to the Supremes. The naive girls face a challenging journey to stardom when they are sent to entertain American troops in the Vietnam War. Drama, starring Deborah Mailman and Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Sri Lanka v South Africa. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Secret discussions and unexpected close encounters occur through the court and beyond as a weary Louis XIV is offered an opportunity to change the course of his conflict with William of Orange. However, it is a face from the King's past that brings his mental crisis to a climax. Tensions increase as mistrustful Madame de Montespan suspects her devout friend Madame Scarron also has feelings for Louis. George Blagden, George Webster, Anna Brewster and Catherine Walker star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Miss Bala
programme.desc: A Mexican woman with dreams of winning a beauty pageant is caught up in a firefight between drug gangs, and finds her friend has disappeared. She goes looking for her, only to end up being taken captive by the criminals and forced to aid their trafficking operation. Crime drama, starring Stephanie Sigman and Noe Hernandez. In Spanish and English.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter O, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton, Danny Clarke and the team transform a Manchester back garden into a time travel-themed space for a Doctor Who fan.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The green-fingered team takes a break from routine duties to attend Gardening Scotland, the biggest horticultural show north of the border. The cream of British growers will be there, with everything from pansies to pelargoniums, and cacti to clematis in a stunning floral frenzy. The presenters meet those who are growing for gold, including the exhibits showing off their medals from last week's Chelsea Flower Show. The programme focuses on the Scottish talent and Scottish plants as it samples the event's unique atmosphere.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A round-up of reports on spring, including Matt Baker examining the return of tulips to Lincolnshire's farmland and Ellie Harrison investigating an influx of migrating jellyfish in Cornwall. Adam Henson gets the chance to be an auctioneer at Exeter's livestock market, and Steve Brown discovers how one of the wonders of the season can only be appreciated in the dark. Plus, a taste of spring with chef Paul Ainsworth.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Scotland chefs hope to impress with their main dishes. Angela Malik prepares a tiffin box featuring a summer biriyani, quail scotch egg and spiced quail breasts, while Michael Bremner takes a huge risk by using ox tongue as the centrepiece of his main. Ally McGrath devises an inventive take on the summer barbecue, using a new method of cooking potatoes to recreate the coals.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Angela Malik, Ally McGrath and Michael Bremner continue their battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Scotland final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scotland chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Gary Parsons - executive chef at Wimbledon - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of sugar-rich foods in Britain, and try to make their own versions of their favourite childhood sweets. The duo also prepare a cheesecake and a sweet-and-sour dish.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms takes a retrospective look at the television appearances made over the years by Oscar-winning actor Laurence Olivier, using rare material from the BBC archives to capture the highlights and milestones of his life and extraordinarily distinguished career.(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: A couple are keen to find suitable husbands for their five daughters. When a wealthy gentleman and his friend arrive in the area, it leads to an encounter between headstrong daughter Elizabeth and aloof gentleman Mr Darcy, and their instant dislike gradually turns into an unexpected romance. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, starring Laurence Olivier and Greer Garson.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Conservationist Dr Julian Fennessy is on a mission to learn more about the giraffes of Africa, but the most important fact is that they are disappearing. In an urgent attempt to save them, he and a determined Ugandan team round up 20 of the world's rarest giraffes to take across and beyond the mighty Nile River. The stakes are high, but if they succeed the reward will be a brighter future for an animal Dr Fennessy believes has been overlooked. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin meets people hoping to make a profit from their antiques in Derby, where the finds include an elegant station wall clock, a unique collection of razors and an immaculate working toy train set. The presenter also visits the Marmite factory in Burton-upon-Trent, Staffordshire. With experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of more than 10,000 people as they race to build Crossrail - a new 73-mile train line linking east and west London, costing £15billion. As they excavate the 26 miles of tunnels, engineers must make sure that listed buildings don't crack, London Underground trains keep running, roads don't have to be shut and the City stays in business. Crucially, they must drive one of their gigantic 1,000-ton tunnel-boring machines through a narrow gap at Tottenham Court Road station without disturbing the passengers on the platforms below.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Evan Davis presents the business ideas contest, as regular panelists Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins assess the profit-making potential of a brand of pork scratchings and a device for folding paper. The entrepreneurs behind a fledgling fashion business also try their luck, but textile tycoon Touker is far from impressed.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A nurse living in Nottingham whose husband is in the army has rarely settled for long in one place and would like to move somewhere with a sense of community. She trades places with a B&B owner from Alaska, who is hoping to escape her small-town life and see more of the world as she approaches retirement.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent, Fitzpatrick and Lavender meet a group of men from a local publishing company, raising the alpha male stakes when the trio discover the exciting perks the publishers receive in their line of business, namely company cars. In the showroom, receptionist Carol tries to get to grips with the new office computer. Elsewhere, in a bid to save face, Fitzpatrick puts faith in his comprehensive knowledge of the company Cachet's home turf, with potentially dangerous consequences for everyone concerned.(n)

programme.title: Dara O Briain Crowd Tickler
programme.desc: The Irish comedian performs at the Hammersmith Apollo, as part of his 2015 tour. Not surprisingly, he leads the audience on a rip-roaring journey through expertly crafted routines, cracking one-liners and the lighting-fast spontaneous gag-making that makes him one of the top exponents of the craft on the circuit at the moment.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v Pakistan. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at Edgbaston in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Saints and Sinners: Britain's Millennium of Monasteries
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez learns how the rich and powerful monasteries that had dominated British society for 1,000 years were turned to ruin within less than a five-year period. During the 15th century many monks were living in palatial monasteries and were patrons of the finest art and architecture. Janina learns how the arrival of the printing press put paid to their monopoly of publishing and education, before she traces the story of their dissolution under the rule of Henry VIII and Thomas Cromwell. She investigates whether the act was that of a over-bearing monarch or the inevitable end to an outmoded institution. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Search for Alfred the Great
programme.desc: Neil Oliver follows the work of the team of historians and scientists trying to discover the final resting place of the remains of 9th-century English king Alfred the Great, with the monarch's bones having been moved so many times over the years that many people concluded that they were lost for ever. Travelling from Winchester to Rome, Neil also tells the story of Alfred's life, revealing a man who forged a united language and identity and laid the foundations of the English nation.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: New series. Disgraced detective John Cardinal is brought back into the heart of a Northern Ontario homicide investigation unit when the body of a 13-year-old girl, previously reported missing, is discovered in Algonquin Bay. Crime thriller, based on the John Cardinal Mysteries series by Canadian author Giles Blunt, starring Billy Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: The Algonquin Bay PD tries to make amends with the community for the botched investigation into Katie Pine's disappearance, and Delorme places herself at odds with Cardinal.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Eurythmics, Spandau Ballet, Phil Collins, Fine Young Cannibals, Tears for Fears, Suzanne Vega and Simply Red.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Kool and the Gang, the Pointer Sisters, Grace Jones, Cameo, Bobby Womack, Sade, Alexander O'Neal and Whitney Houston.(n)

programme.title: Black Music Legends of the 1980s
programme.sub-title: Lionel Richie - Dancing on the Ceiling.
programme.desc: Profile of the soul singer, who found fame in the 1970s as frontman of the Commodores. The programme looks at his departure from the band in 1982 and subsequent international success as a solo artist. With contributions by Kenny Rogers, Lemar, Motown songwriter and producer Gloria Jones and video director Bob Giraldi.(n)

programme.title: Lionel Richie at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the singer, including his first Top of the Pops appearance with the Commodores in 1979 and highlights from his 2009 concert at the BBC's Maida Vale studios.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1984.
programme.desc: Contributors including Howard Jones, Nik Kershaw, Paul Young, Nigel Planer and Midge Ure recall the year of big hair and big tunes, when a BBC ban on Frankie Goes to Hollywood's Relax led to an embarrassing gap on the show when it reached the top of the chart. The year saw the rise of one-man acts such as Nik Kershaw and Howard Jones, while Sade brought a stripped-back soulful vibe to jazz pop. German singer Nena hit the top spot with 99 Red Balloons, while the Special AKA's Free Nelson Mandela combined a political message with an irresistible tune. The year ended with the stars of the day pooling their talents with Band Aid's charity single Do They Know It's Christmas?.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1984: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A compilation of performances, featuring the Smiths, Duran Duran, Sade, the Weather Girls, Wham! and Bronski Beat. Further stellar appearances come from the show's debuts of iconic Americans Madonna, Miami Sound Machine and Cyndi Lauper - who runs riot in the studio. Frankie Goes to Hollywood celebrate their chart dominance of the year with one of their celebrated renditions of Two Tribes, while a less credible but arguably more memorable ditty comes courtesy of Black Lace.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.sub-title: Temptations, Michael Jackson and the Real Thing.
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Temptations, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Queens
programme.desc: Professor Joann Fletcher explores what it was like to be a woman of power in ancient Egypt, examining four of the civilisation's most powerful female rulers through a wealth of spectacular buildings, personal artefacts and amazing tombs. As well as the women who held the title of pharaoh, many others played key roles in running the state and shaping every aspect of life.(n)

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Cities
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Liz Bonnin join Dr Sarah Parcak on a journey to Egypt to find out whether cities, temples and pyramids are lying beneath the sands. The potential existence of the buildings was suggested by satellites as part of an alternative approach to archaeology.(n)

programme.title: Egyptian Journeys with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank travels to the desolate ruins of Amarna in search of the truth about Akhenaten, the most radical pharaoh ever to rule Egypt. He converted the nation to his own religion and built a sacred city in the desert where he lived with his wife Nefertiti until their dreams ended in tragedy.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: American Epic: Out of the Many the One.
programme.desc: A look at Hawaiian influences on US roots music, including the invention of the steel guitar by Joseph Kekuku, and the development of Cajun music in Louisiana. Plus, the story of one of the genre's unsung heroes, Mississippi John Hurt, who became a star in the 1920s, only to return to life as a share cropper in the Great Depression, before a revival of his music in the 1960s.(n)

programme.title: Southern Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by classic Southern rock acts on shows including The Old Grey Whistle Test, In Concert and Wogan. Featuring Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Charlie Daniels Band, the Ozark Mountain Daredevils, Delaney & Bonnie with Eric Clapton, Dickey Betts, formerly of the Allman Brothers Band, the Marshall Tucker Band, Black Oak Arkansas, Greg Allman with Cher, and Edgar Winter.(n)

programme.title: Total Italian Football
programme.desc: This special episode of Total Italian Football looks back at some of the key games and moments from the 2016/17 Serie A campaign. 1/2.(n)

programme.title: Rugby Tonight Extra
programme.desc: A look back at the 2016/17 domestic and European action.(n)

programme.title: World's Strongest Man
programme.desc: This special episode features behind-the-scenes access at World's Strongest Man 2016, including exclusive insight from Game of Thrones star Hafthor Julius Bjornsson.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.desc: North Melbourne and Richmond meet in round 11 of the Australian Football League. North have won seven of the last eight meetings, including two victories by more than 60 points.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: The latest news and updates from the UEFA Champions League.(n)

programme.title: The Manager
programme.desc: An in-depth interview with LMA Manager of the Year Antonio Conte at the end of a glorious first season with Chelsea as he discusses his methods, influences and life as a champion.(n)

programme.title: Sport in Focus
programme.desc: An exclusive interview with Gareth Bale as the Real Madrid star gears up for the UEFA Champions League final against Juventus in his home city of Cardiff.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Lynsey Hipgrave is joined by Champions League winners Steven Gerrard, Steve McManaman and Owen Hargreaves to preview this year's final in Cardiff between Juventus and Real Madrid.(n)

programme.title: America's Cup
programme.desc: Day four from the second round-robin of qualifiers at the prestigious America's Cup in Bermuda. The competition is the oldest trophy in international sport, dating back to 1851.(n)

programme.title: Live America's Cup

Usually shunned by the popular kids, Seth and Evan luck into an invitation to a party, and spend a long day, with the help of their nerdy friend Fogell, trying to score enough alcohol to lubricate the party and inebriate two girls, Jules and Becca, so they can kick-start their sex lives and go off to college with a summer full of experience and new skills(n)

programme.title: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
programme.desc: Matthew McConaughey and Kate Hudson light up the screen in this effervescent romantic comedy. She plays a journalist writing an article on how to drive a man away; he is a slick ad executive who must make a woman fall in love with him in 10 days if he's to land a big account promoting diamonds. A breezy script and the charm of the leads make this a great date movie. Bebe Neuwirth, Robert Klein(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 418. Kevin O'Leary offers to give an entrepreneur $1 million; six kid inventors present a device that could help save lives; a woman provides a taste of her s'mores-inspired mini-muffin recipe; two brothers from Austin have an interesting idea for a sushi restaurant; and a New Yorker talks up her online-therapy business. Also: an update on a Season 3 cargo-management system that didn't get any backing from the Sharks(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 515. A former NFL player from Anthem, Ariz., pitches his idea for a mobile fitness company for kids; and the Sharks meet a self-described "wall doctor" from Chester County, Pa. Also: an affordable solution to the problem of too many smartphone photos; an idea for making webcams safer; and an update on Nuts 'N More from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 621. A cattleman from Peoria, Ill., returns to show the Sharks what he has learned about the gourmet meat business since he first appeared on the show during Season 4. Also: a lingerie line that's sewn by women in need; and an update on Barbara Corcoran's Season 6 investment in Pipcorn(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 717. Included: a 16-year-old environmentalist from Melbourne, Fla., has an eco-friendly way to dispose of plastic bottles; a former soap-opera villainess from Sherman Oaks, Cal., shows off her stylish and sun-safe one-piece swimsuit; business partners from Washington, D.C., pitch their app, which creates exercise playlists for the everyday person; and a man from Cornith, Texas, reveals what potentially could be hiding in the Sharks' mattresses. Also: a follow-up on Signal Vault from Season 7(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

Lynn's hairdressing business and Lee's job keep the couple very busy, so making the most of their quality time together is key. Laura Hamilton makes it her mission to show them a variety of properties as close to the city centre as possible, on a budget of £170,000.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke returns to Harrogate, North Yorkshire, to check on the progress of Carol and Majid Nadry, who after 25 years living in a bungalow, embarked on an ambitious midlife adventure - buying a water tower to turn into a five-storey home. After huge delays and eye-watering legal costs, the couple have finally built the two-storey extension that was the key to creating a family home with character. George sees how the industrial heritage of this unique building is beautifully complemented by a 21st-century glass and sheet-metal extension that finally realises the old water tower's hidden potential.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Tracks with Tony Robinson

In the first episode, Tony delves into the stories, songs and sacred places along the Icknield Way in Norfolk and Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Legend

Starring Tom Hardy as both twins, with Emily Browning, Christopher Eccleston and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Winnie-the-Pooh: The Most Famous Bear in the World
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh celebrates the 90th anniversary of the creation of the Winnie-the-Pooh stories, which were originally written by AA Milne for his only child Christopher Robin, who featured as a character in the tales. On their first appearance, Milne's stories and poems featuring Pooh Bear became a publishing sensation, and Alan heads to Cotchford Farm in Sussex, where Milne created Pooh, to find out why they were capable of capturing the imaginations of millions. He also takes in the wild woodland that formed the basis for the Hundred Acre Wood, and visits Harrods toy department, where Milne first bought the toys that would later become the inspiration behind the likes of Pooh himself, along with his friends Piglet, Eeyore, Tigger, Kanga and Roo. Includes interviews with Milne's biographer Ann Thwaite, social historian Hester Barron, journalist Matthew Sweet, and children's author Brian Sibley.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The programme returns with cameras once again following a high-speed police interception unit at work in Durham and Cleveland. Andy Lawson is involved in a high-speed chase through a housing estate, Kev Salter carries out an early morning raid on a suspected drug dealer's house and a drunk driver is grumpy when pulled over, then irate when he is arrested.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Rick Edwards joins Durham and Cleveland's dedicated team of enforcers as they hunt down, stop and lock-up anyone breaking the rules of the road, with Kev Salter showing him how to spot a drunk driver, before the presenter rides shotgun on an interceptor night shift. Plus, Paul `Jacko' Jackson collars a boozed-up driver and chases down an all-terrain tearaway.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: This week's edition examines life on the dole in Scotland, including aspiring pop stars Zedd and Saffire, who live in Portobello, Edinburgh and receive £17,000 a year in benefits. After a failed attempt to start her own business in Australia, Kit is back in her home town of Wishaw, North Lanarkshire, to sign on and stay with friends, while Stirling resident Kirsty is desperate for work and is convinced her weight and mild learning disability are stopping her from getting a job. The 30-year-old's stay-at-home parents Rosie and Desmond believe that discrimination is to blame.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: People who have had their benefits cut or withheld since tougher sanctions began in October 2012, including Terry, whose payments were stopped after his partner clocked up more than 24 hours in one week in her job as a care worker. Other people featured include an aspiring rapper left with £3 a day to live on, a single mother-of-three who blames her jobless state on being overweight, and a former stripper who decides to move to Spain when he is threatened with being reassessed.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: The second of a two-part special of the programme that examines the lives of people on benefits, focusing on those who have large families. Tom and Stacey claim more than £70,000 a year from the state to support themselves and their 14 children, and run their household with military precision.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A man is subjected to a campaign of terror after complaining when his neighbours stole part of his land by erecting a fence in the garden. Junk mail, vicious allegations and slashed tyres become regular occurences, until a late-night raid on his home is caught on video. In Lincolnshire, a firm friendship turns sour when one resident suspects her neighbours are taking advantage of her kindness. Plus, a bitter residential dispute that begins when a woman's complaints about an old friend's son result in him being sent to jail.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Gareth and Craig investigate a possible case of mistaken identity in Shropshire, then in south Wales find themselves embroiled in a bitter dispute between two dog owners over a vet's bill. Steve and Phil have to evict a distraught young family from a former high street bank in west London, before paying a call on an elderly tailor in north London.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Officers chase £4,500 in court fees in North Wales after a property deal turned sour, and in Birmingham the agents try to collect over £3,500 from a single mum who defaulted on loan repayments. Elsewhere in Worcestershire, the enforcement agents try to recover more than £10,000 from a shop-keeper for fraudulently keeping a deposit during a property sale.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Chameleon's planted clues lead the team on a wild goose chase as it searches for NSA agent Mike Atley, who the criminal claims to have in his custody. Callen is faced with a difficult decision when he is told to release the Chameleon in order to save Atley's life, and contemplates subduing his nemesis once and for all. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ziva's family farm in Israel is devastated by an explosion, and the former NCIS agent is reported dead. Determined to seek justice, Tony ignores orders to stay off the case and sets out to track down Trent Kort, the British national and ex-CIA agent who remains the prime suspect. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.sub-title: Most Shocking Celebrity Moments of the 90s.
programme.desc: A countdown of infamous incidents from the 1990s, including Hugh Grant's arrest and OJ Simpson's murder trial. The programme also looks back at Eric Cantona kicking a fan during a match, Jarvis Cocker interrupting Michael Jackson's performance at the Brit awards, and David and Victoria Beckham's lavish wedding. Featuring contributions from Louis Walsh, Shaun Ryder, Bez, Michael Burke, Darren Day, Gail Porter, Tim Vincent, Liz McClarnon and Kerry Katona.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Setup
programme.desc: A criminal takes part in a profitable diamond heist, only to be betrayed by his partner in crime who makes off with the loot. The aggrieved thief swears revenge on his former friend, and seeks the aid of a powerful Mob boss in taking back his ill-gotten gains. Thriller, with Bruce Willis, Curtis `50 Cent' Jackson and Ryan Phillippe.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton look back over highlights from the series. A two-bedroom semi in the Black Country made quite an impression, thanks to the unmistakable smell of dogs and a large collection of dolls, as did a cottage in Northamptonshire that seemed to have four sitting rooms.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: Faith tries to pull a big box and realises she is not going to be able to manage alone.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Roary spills oil on the racing track and worries the other cars might slip on it.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet makes waves as he drives an unusual tractor.(n)

programme.title: Mr Men
programme.desc: Little Miss Daredevil tests her latest invention on Mr Quiet, while Mr Lazy's new remote control causes Little Miss Calamity to have bad dreams.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig, George and Peppa take Goldie the fish to the vet because she is not eating her food.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family go to a funfair, where Mummy Pig tries to win a giant teddy.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Oscar the orangutan does not like his elongated arms, and no amount of flattery from Gertie the giraffe seems to change his mind - until his long arms prove vital to a rescue.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Alex the mild-mannered giant suddenly turns up in Adventure Bay, and it is up to Ryder and the pups find a way to keep him busy and avoid more accidental damage to the town.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: A heavy storm causes damage to the Fixham lighthouse. Bob and his team must fix it before dark, but the repair job soon becomes a rescue mission.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Impetuous Norman decides to use super-strong glue to build a model aeroplane, and ends up getting stuck to his door while a fire rages on his bed.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Olly and Stan try to find Mamma Duck and her two infants a new home when Alfie the Elephant drinks their pond water at the zoo.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: The Daylight Robbers plan a concert, but lead singer Percy goes down with a cold leaving Olly and Stan having to find a replacement.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Humdinger risks ruining Adventure Bay's reputation as the world's friendliest town.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Zeg finds a tiny dinosaur egg, and decides to return it to its Truckodactyl mother, so he, Blaze and AJ set out on an exciting journey across a prehistoric landscape.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Popping Balloons.
programme.desc: Noddy and his friends are each given a colourful balloon at the end of Smartysaurus's party, but when a number of balloons start bursting, Noddy tries to find out why.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: When Sam the seal wants to learn how to dance, Wissper helps by asking natural mover Stripes the tiger to teach him.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Daisy and Poppy's Trip to the Museum.
programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy cause chaos during a trip to a museum.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: When the girls bake magical flying cookies, Zeta and Nazboo sneak into their palace to steal the flying flour.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Want to Be a Nurse.
programme.desc: Maid falls ill, giving Princess the chance to play nurse and come up with lots of ways to make her patient feel better.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her friends learn how to count by playing games at Madame Gazelle's school.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and the family try to get to the playground, but Mr Bull's roadworks block the way.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle decides that Gaston should have a birthday party after finding out he has never had one before.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: A mysterious man visits April on Hallowe'en and shows an interest in a hideous six-armed idol that is capable of invoking a horde of criminal imps.(n)

programme.title: Cats Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos, including cats playing musical instruments, dressed in costumes and riding on vacuum cleaners. Narrated by Iain Lee, with commentary by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The time has arrived for Georgie Barrat to see how far Monkey Tree FC have come from avoiding relegation, as she finds out which tech worked best - as well as deliver one final push. Jon Bentley pits the Amazon Echo against the Google Home to see how they match up to being a music player, personal assistant and home automation controller. In London, Ortis Deley gets the lowdown at the world's best virtual reality show. As well as the latest consumer gadgets, he visits a series of VR worlds that show how advanced technology will be used in the not-so-distant future.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter goes on three drug busts, accompanied on two of them by newcomer Pete Tate, while Ben Sutcliffe shows presenter Rick Edwards the ropes, taking him on a fast-paced ride through Taser, method of entry and firearms training. Plus, a look back at two classic stories, showing the lengths to which people will go to hide their narcotics and how the police managed to gain access to a suspected drugs den.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Stu Chaney deals with an alleged assault and a missing crossbow, Amanda Stokes discovers crack on the A19 and Paul Faulkner apprehends a bloodied drunk driver hiding on a rooftop. A brand new patrol car takes a battering when Neil Armstrong helps manage the pursuit of a runaway MG.(n)

programme.title: Asteroid: Final Impact
programme.desc: A scientist exposes a plan to use his technology for government surveillance, but his whistle-blowing costs him everything. When he detects signs that the Earth is due to have a devastating collision with an asteroid, he is forced to become a fugitive to seek a way to save the world. Disaster movie, starring Mark Lutz, Anna Van Hooft and Emilie Ullerup.(n)

programme.title: 10.0 Earthquake
programme.desc: A fracking operation causes a series of earthquakes to hit Los Angeles. A scientist realises this is just a build-up to a larger quake that will destroy the whole city. Aided by a repentant fracking engineer, she tries to find a way to divert the seismic activity to an unpopulated area. Disaster movie, starring Cameron Richardson and Henry Ian Cusick. Includes 5 News Update at 4.20pm.(n)

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster movie, with John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor. Edited for language. Includes 5 News Update at 6.05pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Jackie Chan's The Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: An American teenager obsessed with kung fu movies is sent back in time to ancient China, where he joins the battle to free the imprisoned Monkey King. The only problem is he has no martial arts skills of his own, and will need the assistance of two legendary warriors to become the hero he needs to be. Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: The Expendables 2
programme.desc: Mercenary leader Barney Ross is recruited by the CIA to recover a top-secret package, only to come to blows with a rival band of hired guns. Barney swears revenge when the other faction kill his protege, and leads his men on a mission to stop their enemies taking over a former Soviet nuclear facility. Action thriller sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone and Jean-Claude Van Damme. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: Greatest Ever Disaster Movies
programme.desc: Giles Coren presents the 40-film countdown as voted for by viewers of Channel 5 and readers of The Times, with contributions from actors including Robert Vaughn, George Kennedy and Ali Larter. Among those featured are the apocalyptic Reign of Fire, The Blob, which launched Steve McQueen's career and 1970s movies Earthquake, The Taking of Pelham One Two Three and Airport. Alive, Mars Attacks, Twister and Deep Impact also make the list, as do blockbusters The Day After Tomorrow and Armageddon, and another McQueen film in the form of The Towering Inferno, which also stars Paul Newman.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: When war veteran Colonel Terry Childers is hung out to dry by military chiefs, he turns to an old friend, army lawyer Colonel Hayes Hodges. Drama(n)

programme.title: Francisco: el Padre Jorge
programme.desc: A journalist recalls memories of her friend Jorge Mario Bergoglio, the man who would later be known as Pope Francis(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: Steve Martin steps into Phil Silver's shoes for this big-screen version of the classic TV comedy. Bilko's past catches up with him when his old nemesis turns up at the base. Dir: Jonathan Lynn(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Romantic melodrama about a young woman who begins a new relationship with a different man each month in order to help them develop into more compassionate individuals. However, there are unexpected repercussions for both parties when she attempts to bring meaning to the life of a hard-hearted, career-centred business executive(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Buckle up for a wild ride as Paul Walker ("Joy Ride") and Vin Diesel ("Pitch Black") put the pedal to the metal in this high-octane action thriller. Diesel plays the leader of a gang of L.A. street racers who moonlight in highway robbery; Walker is the undercover cop who befriends him. Michelle Rodriguez, Jordana Brewster, Rick Yune, Chad Lindberg(n)

programme.title: El Hueco
programme.desc: A man who has been planning to buy the cemetery plot alongside that of his long-time love discovers it has been sold to someone else, and that's when the plot thickens(n)

programme.title: Permitidos
programme.desc: A couple joke about getting a one-time pass for a night of infidelity with their favorite celebrity, but they must deal with the consequences when the man actually meets his(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Life or Something like It
programme.desc: Stephen Herek's romantic comedy stars Angelina Jolie as Lanie Kerrigan, a New York-based television news reporter who anchors the morning show and is engaged to baseball star Cal Cooper, with whom she shares her flash lifestyle. Leaving aside her sparky working relationship with cameraman Pete, it all looks close to perfect to the outsider. But things take an abrupt about turn when she's sent to interview Prophet Jack, a sidewalk savant feted for his ability to predict football scores. He dutifully predicts the next day's results for her, as well as unseasonal weather, along with the unwelcome, unsettling news that she will die in a week's time. So far, so dismissible - until the scores come in, together with an unexpected hail storm, leaving Lanie with some serious thinking to do about what she wants from (her apparently foreshortened) life and her relationships..(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley learns not only that his dad was a lethal hitman, but also that he's inherited the same skills(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband take a cross-country journey to a small coastal town where they bond with its quirky but wise inhabitants(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul (Ethan Hawke), headed to Mexico with his faithful collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang of misfits and finds himself exiled by the town marshal (John Travolta), which sparks a bloody quest for revenge. Karen Gillan and Taissa Farmiga co-star. Ti West wrote and directed this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Based on a series of books by Patrick O'Brian, MASTER AND COMMANDER plunges viewers deep into the story of a British Navy ship at sea during the Napoleonic war. Russell Crowe stars as Aubrey, the charismatic captain who wrestles with issues like honour, pride, duty, sacrifice and loyalty while using ingenious tactics to engage his prey--a much larger and better-equipped French Man o' War. Paul Bettany plays his friend, the ship's doctor(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: The residents of an oceanside Florida town are bemused by sharp-suited real estate developers. While some consider what they'll do with the pay-out, others fight to keep their place in the sun. Complex, multi-stranded drama(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: Magnum 44 thriller. In his fourth screen outing as 'Dirty' Harry Callahan, Clint Eastwood tracks down a rape victim who is killing off the men responsible(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. Billy Connolly is a howl as a zombie who's been domesticated to do work around a suburban couple's home, where he befriends their young son. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. One man, who has become amphibious, tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Lone Survivor director Peter Berg helmed this docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that Mike Williams (Mark Wahlberg) and the rest of the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival. Kate Hudson, Kurt Russell, and John Malkovich co-star(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., in the year 2054, murder has been eliminated. The future is seen and the guilty punished before the crime has ever been committed. From a nexus deep within the Justice Department's elite Precrime Unit, all the evidence to convict - from imagery alluding to the time, place and other details - is seen by Pre-Cogs, three psychic beings whose visions of murder have never been wrong. It is the nation's most advanced crime force, a perfect system. And no-one works harder for Precrime than its top man, Chief John Anderton. Destroyed by a tragic loss, Anderton has thrown all of his passion into a system that could potentially spare thousands of people from the tragedy he lived through. Six years later, the coming vote to take it national has only fuelled his conviction that Precrime works. Anderton has no reason to doubt it... until he becomes its #1 suspect(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: When war veteran Colonel Terry Childers is hung out to dry by military chiefs, he turns to an old friend, army lawyer Colonel Hayes Hodges. Drama(n)

programme.title: Francisco: el Padre Jorge
programme.desc: A journalist recalls memories of her friend Jorge Mario Bergoglio, the man who would later be known as Pope Francis(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: Steve Martin steps into Phil Silver's shoes for this big-screen version of the classic TV comedy. Bilko's past catches up with him when his old nemesis turns up at the base. Dir: Jonathan Lynn(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Crime of Passion: The Pamela Smart Story
programme.desc: Crime of Passion: The Pamela Smart Story. Youth, seduction, and violence populate the landscape of the A&E program American Justice: Crimes of Passion -- The Pamela Smart Story. As an attractive motivated schoolteacher, Pam Smart was carving out a successful middle-class life. But, inwardly, she was passionately dissatisfied. Her husband held her back, yet she couldn't afford to live alone. Then, Smart met teenager Bill Flynn. He fell for her and she seemed flattered by the attention. Eventually, their relationship became intimate and Smart found the answer to all her problems. Through manipulation and claims of abuse, she convinced her young lover to kill her husband and that's just what he did with the help of two friends. But, Smart's calculating manner gave her away when police suspected her of being less than grief-stricken. What followed was the first live broadcast trial in history. The media explosion surrounding the case was unparalleled. Smart turned out to be a lot less organized than she thought. When her killers caved and word got around of her arranged hit, she was doomed. A&E takes the viewer back to the original trial of the century(n)

programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. programme.title: Ultimate Warfare
programme.sub-title: Fallujah: The Taking of Terror Central.
programme.desc: Examining the inner workings of warfare, from the major strategies and formidable munitions to the minutiae that can separate success and failure. Beginning with Operation Phantom Fury in Fallujah, Iraq in 2004, which was meant to be a 48-hour battle, but saw the insurgents put up stern resistance. The programme examines how the joint US-British-Iraqi forces managed to reclaim the city.(n)

programme.title: Time Team

programme.title: King Solomon's Mines
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adventurer Allan Quatermain plunges into the unexplored recesses of the African jungles to uncover the truth behind the legends concerning the mine. Adaptation of the classic adventure tale, starring Patrick Swayze, Alison Doody and Gavin Hood.(n)

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?.(n)

programme.title: Mercy Street
programme.desc: Confederate belle Emma is overwhelmed by her friend Tom's mental state. Dr Foster wrestles with his marriage and career as Mary tries to improve her patients' lives with Samuel's help. Aurelia submits to Silas's advances in exchange for his help.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The Secretary of State for Northern Ireland and his two daughters are killed by a car bomb and a British Army base is attacked. Amid a national outcry, an Irish terrorist group deny responsibility for the second bombing and a Bosnian war criminal is spotted entering the country, prompting the team to suspect a revenge campaign is under way. Matthew Macfadyen, Natasha Little and Keeley Hawes star.(n)

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: While the men of Barbershop and Barbershop 2 have plenty to mouth off about, they may have met their match in the female staff and clientele of a nearby beauty shop. Directed by Bille Woodruff, Beauty Shop revolves around these women led by Gina (Queen Latifah), who opened Beauty Shop to give all the females in the community, from a conservative Southern socialite (Andie MacDowell) to a poetry-reciting stylist, a place to talk about life, love, and the issues of the day, all while getting their hair done. Bryce Wilson puts in a supporting performance, as does Kevin Bacon, who plays the snooty owner of a rival salon(n)

programme.title: WAGS Miami

programme.desc: A look at which animal could be crowned `king'.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
