programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Danny DeVito stars in this thoughtful comedy about Bill Rago, an advertising executive who gets fired from his job and is forced to take on an army job teaching poorly educated boot camp recruits to read. With a little ingenuity, he gets them reading Shakespeare's Hamlet, but finds opposition in the guise of Sgt Cass (Gregory Hines), who dislikes civilians and thinks he is wasting his time teaching screw-ups to think for themselves. Also stars Ed Begley Jr and a young Mark Wahlberg(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Jeff Stilson. Jeff Stilson's routine covers a range of subjects, including divorce, men in delivery rooms, and math problems regarding bungee jumping. Taped in San Francisco at the Fillmore Auditorium(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Three O'Clock High
programme.desc: The first feature film from director Phil Joanou (State of Grace), Three O' Clock High chronicles a high school nerd's much hyped after-school bout with the infamous class bully. When the impish Jerry Mitchell (Casey Siemaszko) is assigned to interview the new transfer student with a supposedly violent past, Buddy Revell (Richard Tyson), he makes the fatal mistake of touching his subject. Revell, who hates being touched, responds by challenging the unwilling Mitchell to a fight at three o'clock in the parking lot. Spanning the course of the school day, the film follows the disaster-bound Mitchell as he soils his good-boy image through various misguided attempts at averting the fight. Also making noteworthy appearances in the film are Jeffrey Tambor and Philip Baker Hall(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: After their mother passes away, four estranged siblings return home to attend the traditional funeral she wanted(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Two spirits find love in an afterlife way station where fates are determined(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: The discovery of marital troubles in her well-to-do Jewish family causes a young woman to question her own upcoming nuptials(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: Enchanting fantasy starring Steve Guttenberg as a curious boat skipper who watches as a group of elderly locals are rejuvenated by some strange 'pods' in a disused swimming pool. It's not long before he realizes that the pods have been put there by the same strangers who have asked to use his boat - strangers who then reveal themselves to be aliens from another planet(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Peanuts Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "The Peanuts Movie," a 2015 computer-animated comedy based on Charles M. Schulz's comic strip "Peanuts." The film is directed by Steve Martino(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: Two children discover a mysterious black box on a beach and develop special powers. They learn that the box contains a message from the future asking for help. But with the FBI closing in, do they have time?(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten
programme.desc: A New Season. No additional information is available(n)

programme.desc: Top Bottom Jump. Topics include "Top," "Bottom" and "Jump."(n)

programme.title: A Little Curious

programme.desc: Bedtime Story. In the Season 46 premiere, Elmo invites Abby to a sleepover, but she needs to learn how to calm down before bedtime(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Mucko Polo, Grouch Explorer. Explorer Mucko Polo (Alan Cumming) helps Elmo, Abby and Oscar use their five senses to look for the grouchiest things on Sesame Street(n)

programme.desc: A dog and a cat give vocabulary lessons in English and Spanish(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Henny Penny. A retooling of "Henny Penny" follows a sky-is-falling election debate in a barnyard after a reporter (voice of Sharon Stone) is hit in the head by an acorn. Voices...Turkey Lurkey: Alan M. Dershowitz. Lucy Goosey: Mary Hart. Foxy Woxy: Johnnie L. Cochran Jr. Merle: Geraldine A. Ferraro. Earl: Rudy Giuliani. Wooster Rooster: John McLaughlin. Ducky Daddles: Henry A. Kissinger. Cocky Locky: Rev. Jesse L. Jackson(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: The Frog Princess. In "The Frog Princess," a human prince learns from his amphibian bride that he can do tasks usually assigned to women, such as cooking and sewing. Voices include Greg Kinnear, Jasmine Guy, Beau Bridges and Scott Thompson(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A stork and his human pal must team up to transport a baby girl to her expectant family, even though storks have long since gotten out of the baby delivery business ever since they started working as couriers for an internet merchant(n)

programme.title: 101 Dalmatians
programme.desc: Fur-ocious fun in the live action version of one of the best-loved Disney classics. Glenn Close is the overwhelmingly evil fashion victim and rich bitch Cruella De Vil in this tale of puppy power. Pongo and Perdy and their human "pets" Roger and Anita, have to rescue their pups when the dastardly Cruella steals them for their skins. Great family entertainment(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Muppets are in London covering a jewel heist(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: In this animated adventure, an eccentric scientist builds a robot child known as Astro Boy based on his deceased son. As Astro Boy grows up, he befriends a gang of scavengers who live in a desolate wasteland on Earth and eventually returns to his hometown of Metro City to protect the populace from a group of dangerous robots(n)

programme.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
programme.desc: Animated story of a wild Mustang stallion captured by horse traders and sold to a cavalry regiment at a frontier outpost, where a cruel colonel attempts to break the free-spirited horse. The stallion escapes in the company of a Native American youth, however, and embarks upon a series of adventures in the harsh and unforgiving times of the Old West(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A stork and his human pal must team up to transport a baby girl to her expectant family, even though storks have long since gotten out of the baby delivery business ever since they started working as couriers for an internet merchant(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: When a young man named Ethan falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, he discovers she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Planet Earth must band together again to fight off an alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack nearly devastated the globe(n)

programme.title: Moon over Parador
programme.desc: While working in a small nation on the Caribbean, an American actor (Richard Dreyfuss) is convinced by the chief of police (Raul Julia) to impersonate the nation's dictator who has recently passed away. The actor really begins to enjoy the role after a while, thanks in part to the dictator's mistress (Sonia Braga)(n)

programme.title: Max
programme.desc: A military dog from Afghanistan is adopted by his late handler's grieving family in the U.S., where his close bond with the soldier's brother leads to a life-altering revelation in this family-friendly adventure from MGM and director Boaz Yakin (who penned the screenplay alongside writer Sheldon Lettich)(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: A Little Curious
programme.desc: Hit Miss Bump. Topics include "Hit," "Miss" and "Bump."(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Abby's Fairy Garden. Elmo gets gardening tips from Abby, but a gnome absconds with his seeds and flower pot, so they play memory games to ensure their return(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.sub-title: Elmo Steps in for Super Grover
programme.desc: Elmo Steps in for Super Grover. Elmo answers distress calls when Super Grover's new sidekick, Horatio, is delayed by getting stuck in doorways. Also: Aloe Blacc performs "Everyday Hero."(n)

programme.desc: Pinky's Big Talent; Pinky Dinky Re-Doo. Pinky helps Tyler recognize his special talent and later tells a story about searching for Mr. Guinea Pig's lost trumpet(n)

programme.desc: The Princess and the Pauper. In "The Princess and the Pauper," the daughter of a washerwoman and a thief switches places with her double, the Princess of Peachburg. Voices include Raven-Symone, David Alan Grier, Phylicia Rashad, Andre Braugher(n)

programme.title: The Electric Company
programme.desc: Fromage Here to Eternity. Annie tries to scoop Lisa, who's been assigned to write about Skeleckian cheese for the school paper(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Robert Rodriguez follows up his successful "Spy Kids" films with another delightful, family-friendly adventure. Bullied and mocked, 10-year-old Max escapes from his dreary life by conjuring up two imaginary superhero friends---Sharkboy and Lavagirl. When his fantasy characters actually come alive, Max joins them on a wild adventure to defeat an über-villain named Mr. Electric(n)

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: Mary is sent to live with her uncle after the death of her parents, but his manner leaves her feeling bitterly alone. Then she discovers a young crippled boy whom she adopts as a playmate, and together they dare to explore a forbidden walled garden(n)

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four inch high people live under the stairs of a family home occupied by, to them at least, giant sized people(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Woodstock and friends embark on an epic adventure in this charming adaptation of the beloved comic strip(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: Rainn Wilson, Hugh Laurie and Reese Witherspoon lend their voices to this high-energy, family-friendly animated movie following a team of wacky monsters who must stop an alien invasion. When alien leader Gallaxhar threatens to take over Earth, the government unleashes the only forces capable of stopping him. Mankind's hope rests with Ginormica, a 49-foot-tall woman; mad scientist Dr. Cockroach; and B.O.B., an indestructible gelatinous blob(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Robert Rodriguez follows up his successful "Spy Kids" films with another delightful, family-friendly adventure. Bullied and mocked, 10-year-old Max escapes from his dreary life by conjuring up two imaginary superhero friends---Sharkboy and Lavagirl. When his fantasy characters actually come alive, Max joins them on a wild adventure to defeat an über-villain named Mr. Electric(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Hawk-like Marine Corps officer Benson Payne (Damon Wayans) attempts to whip into shape the usual assortment of misfit JROTC kids in this minor remake of The Private War of Major Benson. Of course, both the major and his pint-sized recruits have something to teach one another. Payne teaches them the value of self-discipline and instills self-confidence in them, and the recruits teach him to stop and smell the roses (not to mention the fact that kids sometimes need coddling rather than screaming). And, of course, there is the annual JROTC statewide competition, which the kids are obligated to win before the movie can end. While there are some funny moments (the major's exhibition in full-dress whites at a school dance, for example), the script seems too color-by-numbers to be interesting to anyone other than undiscriminating younger viewers(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Witch Queen, who has returned from the dead, in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: Model for Murder
programme.desc: Seeking his dead brother's girlfriend, an American finds murder in London's fashion industry as he becomes embroiled in a jewelry robbery plot(n)

programme.title: Batman: The Killing Joke
programme.desc: The seminal graphic novel written by Alan Moore (Watchmen) that ushered in a new, darker spin on The Dark Knight is adapted for the screen in this animated feature. The Joker (voiced by Mark Hamill) launches his most diabolical assault ever upon Commissioner Gordon (Ray Wise) and his family, including his daughter Barbara Gordon (Tara Strong). It's up to Batman (Kevin Conroy) to stop this madman in his tracks - but in doing so, he'll realize how he and his arch nemesis are very much the same. Extras include featurettes, bonus cartoons, sneak peeks and more(n)

programme.title: Clean and Sober
programme.desc: The directorial debut of Glenn Gordon Caron, the creator of the television series Moonlighting (1985-89), this intense, gritty drama was received as one of the best-ever cinematic treatments of substance abuse. Michael Keaton stars as Daryl Poynter, a hustling, successful Philadelphia real estate agent who has become addicted to cocaine. He's already got problems, including nearly a $100,000 embezzled from his employer and lost on the stock market, when he wakes up one morning with a young woman dead in his bed from a coke overdose. His company is asking questions about the missing funds, and the dead girl's father is plastering his neighborhood with posters accusing Daryl of being a murderer, so he decides to hide out in an anonymous drug treatment program. There, however, Daryl runs into tough-minded counselor and former addict Craig (Morgan Freeman), who has heard all of Daryl's lies and tricks before. Daryl also finds romance with an abused fellow addict, Charlie Standers (Kathy Baker), and understanding with his Alcoholics Anonymous sponsor (M. Emmet Walsh)(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie is seeing his single friends get married one by one. Not something he's worried about, until his current girlfriend Anne catches the bouquet at his friend Marco's wedding. Feeling his wild partying days are numbered, he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town, insulted by his apparently defeatist attempt to tie the knot. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day! Can he beat the clock in time to claim his inheritance?(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Back in the late 1970s, author Cameron Crowe banked upon his youthful appearance to pose as a teen-aged high school student. The results of his hands-on research was the revelatory book Fast Times at Ridgemont High, which went on to spectacular success as a theatrical feature. The sociological inner lining of Crowe's book was sacrificed in favor of standard teen-movie dialogue and Animal House-style comedy, but the film is impossible to dislike, and it spawned a legion of future imitators. Ostensibly, the main characters are brother and sister Jennifer Jason Leigh and Judge Reinhold. However, the real breakthrough star is Sean Penn as the perpetually zoned-out Jeff Spicoli. It is Penn who has the film's most famous scene, wherein the decorum of teacher Hand (Ray Walston)'s classroom is interrupted by a pizza delivery. Fast Times at Ridgemont High was spun off into a TV series, the short-lived 1986 weekly Fast Times(n)

programme.title: High Maintenance
programme.desc: Selfie. An aspiring writer persuades The Guy to stay for an interview, but it's interrupted by her social-media habits. Meanwhile, a former customer needs The Guy's help(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: Swashbuckling fantasy adventure in which immortals do battle with one another down the ages towards a final, decisive encounter. One of the combatants is a 16th-century Scot, wounded in battle, who is pursued to contemporary America by the most feared of all warriors - the Kurgan(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Two gunmen become the marshal and deputy of a lawless Old West mining town and take on a corrupt rancher(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Sinister 2
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, two young brothers must defend themselves against a malevolent spirit that feeds on the corruption of innocence, and that documents its exploits in home movies(n)

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Steven Seagal as a chef who gets caught up in the hijacking of a train. Casey Ryback used to be a Navy SEAL, but he left it all behind and opted for a quieter life in catering. However, when he accompanies his niece on a cross-country train trip Ryback little suspects that he is about to be plunged into another life-or-death situation. The train is about to be taken over by Travis Dane, a psychopathic criminal who needs it to help him gain control of a high-tech satellite which could create havoc on Earth if it fell into the wrong hands. Ryback is on the scene - but can he do anything to stop Dane before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Barely Legal
programme.desc: Fred, Deacon and Matt are three high school kids who, like most teenage boys, are obsessed with sex. However, when Deacon loses his job at an adult video store, the guys are left high and dry, until one of them gets an idea -- they've seen enough porn movies to know what the average viewer expects from one, so why don't they make one themselves?(n)

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader and his new partner Robin do battle with DA Harvey Dent and vengeful scientist The Riddler. Action adventure(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: Wingmen. Bret is in love with the girl from the pet store but is too shy to ask her out so Jemaine and Dave lend a hand. Jemaine enlists their old friend John the mugger to make Bret look tough, with predictable results(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) races to solve the mystery of his past while being hunted by members of the very organization he was hired into as director Paul Greengrass brings author Robert Ludlum's popular character back to the big screen for his third feature outing. David Strathairn, Julia Stiles, Joan Allen, and Paddy Considine co-star(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas and tearing apart his letter to Santa, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family(n)

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Cool jazz drama from Spike Lee . Band leader Bleek Gilliam plays the horn like a dream but playing two women is a nightmare that creates friction with his ambitious sax player Shadow. Branford Marsalis provides the score(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: Spike Lee received an Oscar nomination for his screenplay about racial tensions in a New York City neighbourhood(n)

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Michael Keaton is Bruce Wayne, an enigmatic millionaire who, following the trauma of witnessing his parent's death as a child, dons a voluminous black cape by night to become the Batman, a shadowy figure who haunts the streets of Gotham City, fighting crime wherever it rears its ugly head. And it doesn't come much uglier than The Joker, a cackling killer with a frozen rictus grin whose deadly laughing gas threatens to wipe out the population of Gotham(n)

programme.title: Powder
programme.desc: Fantasy concerning an albino youth with advanced intelligence and electromagnetic powers, and the prejudice he encounters in a Texas town(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A team of incarcerated supervillains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences(n)

programme.title: Formula 51
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays a pharmaceutical genius who has used his knowledge to make a fortune in illegal drugs, particularly with Formula 51, named after its potency above heroin, crack, anything. But instead of selling it to his drug lord employer, he jets to Liverpool where Robert Carlyle is acting as broker for Ricky Tomlinson, who's prepared to offer $20m for the formula - money Jackson would love to spend if he can stay alive long enough in Ronny Yu's fast moving crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Funny Games
programme.desc: Michael Haneke's American re-make of his 1997 German version loses none of the terror or horror in the translation. An all-American family - George, Ann and son Georgie - arrive at their summer cottage for a yachting holiday. Two polite young men, Paul and Peter introduce themselves as neighbours but suddenly and brutally instil a nihilistic, sadistic regime on the family, playing mind games and torturing them. Haneke famously makes the audience complicit to events, rewinding events, having Paul and Peter address the audience directly and making the violence happen off screen but having it still horribly audible in this claustrophobic nightmare(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Smilla's Sense of Snow
programme.desc: Smilla Jaspersen, a Greenlander, lives in Copenhagen. A young boy falls to his death from the roof of her apartment building; his death is ruled an accident, yet Smilla, an expert on ice and snow, can tell from his footprints that he was running from someone. Smilla begins her own investigation, forming an uneasy friendship (and perhaps a romance) with her neighbor, a mechanic. Smilla uncovers a trail of clues, leading her towards a secretive corporation that has made several mysterious expeditions to Greenland. What are they looking for? Were they somehow responsible for the boy's death? We'll find the answer on Gela Alta, a frozen island off Greenland's western coast(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'
programme.desc: A look at "The Huntsman: Winter's War," a 2016 prequel to "Snow White and the Huntsman" that follows the Huntsman and his secret lover Sara as they attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest. programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha (Molly Ringwald) suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork (Anthony Michael Hall) keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake (Michael Schoeffling). Moving from Samantha's family home as it's invaded by outre relatives to a high-school dance where nothing seems to go her way, this bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments of not only Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters, from a hapless Japanese exchange student to a prom queen and a posse of barely pubescent nerds. A climactic party scene at which these various strata of young America overcome their rigid hierarchies sets the stage for resolutions both tender and torrid(n)

She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? programme.desc: A single and freewheeling travel writer finds that adapting to the nine-to-five lifestyle isn't as easy as it looks when her ailing father hires her to take control of his successful bridal magazine in this marriage-minded comedy starring Heather Graham, David Sutcliffe, Sandra Oh, and Taye Diggs. Upon returning to her hometown to once again be a bridesmaid in yet another wedding, jet-lagged, gin-soaked travel writer Pippa McGee (Graham) soon learns that her tyrannical publishing magnate father has been hospitalized after suffering a serious heart attack. As Pippa rushes to his bedside and the ailing mogul asks her to take editorial control of one of his most popular magazines, her excitement soon turns sour upon learning that the magazine in question is not a political or travel magazine, but the one and only Wedding Bells monthly. Determined to succeed despite the constant reminders of just how single she truly is, Pippa is horrified to learn that the man her father has chosen as her publishing mentor is the same man that she drunkenly came on to at her close friend's recent wedding(n)

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Murder by the Book. Looking more like a unmade bed than one of the world's greatest homicide detectives, Lt. Columbo is still the best man to solve the mysterious death of a popular mystery writer. Though he quickly finds the culprit, the killer has devised airtight alibis and Columbo must use all of his considerable faculties to trick him into a confession. Steven Spielberg's direction coupled with Steven Bochco's deft writing and Peter Falk's flawless portrayal of the laid-back gumshoe, makes "Murder by the Book" one of the series' finest episodes(n)

programme.title: Mystery Woman: Vision of a Murder
programme.desc: This Hallmark Channel TV movie is one of several starring Kellie Martin as Samantha "Sam" Kinsey, the owner of a British-style American bookshop which specializes in mystery novels. As is her habit, Sam ends up playing amateur detective herself, this time at a fancy health spa called Drummonds. One of the spa's customers, a woman named Debbie (Allison Smith) is found murdered, and suspicion immediately falls upon Alice (Bess Meyer), whose husband George (Scott Grimes) and Debbie were having an affair. Complicating matters is the presence of a psychic named Emily (Felicia Day) who with unbecoming eagerness offers to direct the police to the location where Debbie's body has been hidden. As a result, Emily herself is accused of the murder--and at this point Sam and her friends Cassie (Nina Siemaszko) and Philby (Clarence Williams III)--the latter a former CIA agent!--try their hand at ferreting out the real killer. Mystery Woman: Vision of Murder debuted June 5, 2005(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Stephen King's best-selling novel gets a faithful, stylish telling here from Brian De Palma, in a story of a teenage girl who discovers she has the extraordinary ability to move objects by the power of her thoughts alone, which eventually leads to mayhem and horror at her high-school prom(n)

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Re-make of a classic horror tale about a millionaire who offers a million dollars to whoever can spend a night in a spooky mansion that was once an insane asylum and location of some horrifying experiments. When a group take up his offer they are unaware that their rich benefactor has rigged the house to have some fun for his money. But he becomes very unaware that the house might really be haunted(n)

programme.title: Haunter
programme.desc: A teenage ghost teams up with a living girl to stop a phantom killer, and break a vicious supernatural cycle in this psychological horror tale from director Vincenzo Natali (Cube, Splice). Lisa Johnson (Abigail Breslin) was just one day shy of 16 when her entire family perished back in 1986. Ever since, the spirits of the young girl and her family have been trapped reliving the monotonous routine of their last day alive. Meanwhile, in the present day, young Olivia (Eleanor Zichy) moves into the Johnson's old house with her family, and bears witness to a disturbing transformation; her typically loving father is acting like a man possessed, prompting the startled teen to fear for her family's safety. Later, after failing to break through to her own family, Lisa manages to communicate with Olivia, and makes a shocking discovery: The house was once owned by a notorious serial killer who preyed on young girls (Stephen McHattie). Although dead, the madman has summoned the power to possess the living, and now dwells in the body of Olivia's father. Now, should the two girls fail to manage to stop the killer soon, the worst may be yet to come(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Stephen King's best-selling novel gets a faithful, stylish telling here from Brian De Palma, in a story of a teenage girl who discovers she has the extraordinary ability to move objects by the power of her thoughts alone, which eventually leads to mayhem and horror at her high-school prom(n)

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: Six months have passed since the rage virus has annihilated the British Isles. The U.S. Army declares that the war against infection has been won, and that the reconstruction of the country can begin. As the first wave of refugees return, a family is reunited--but one of them unwittingly carries a terrible secret(n)

programme.title: Daybreakers
programme.desc: In a futuristic world overrun by vampires, a renegade bloodsucker assists the remaining human refugees. Meanwhile, vampire-run corporations try to develop a viable substitute for blood before their supply runs out(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in what is doubtless the key question of this film. A year after foiling the terrorist takeover of a high-rise office building in the first movie, McClane is waiting to pick up his wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), at Dulles International Airport just outside Washington, D.C., on Christmas Eve. Scheduled to arrive the same evening is Ramon Esperanza (Franco Nero), a South American political figure who is being brought to the United States to stand trial for his role in a drug-smuggling ring. However, a group of terrorists, led by renegade American military officer Col. Stuart (William Sadler), take control of the airport, scuttling radio transmissions and placing their own men in the control tower. Stuart and his men ensure that Esperanza's plane lands safely, and then demand that Stuart and his men be given a fully-fueled 747 and free passage wherever they choose to go. Otherwise, they will guide the many circling jets waiting for landing instructions into definite crash landings, killing the many passengers on board. Not willing to stand aside as terrorists once again threaten his wife's life, the wise-cracking McClane once again leaps into action to foil Stuart's plans and bring the passenger jets safely to the ground. William Atherton, John Amos, Dennis Franz, and John Leguizamo highlight the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Cop John McClane teams with a shop owner to outwit a terrorist who is making him perform a series of dangerous tasks all around Manhattan(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in what is doubtless the key question of this film. Scheduled to arrive the same evening is Ramon Esperanza (Franco Nero), a South American political figure who is being brought to the United States to stand trial for his role in a drug-smuggling ring. However, a group of terrorists, led by renegade American military officer Col. Stuart (William Sadler), take control of the airport, scuttling radio transmissions and placing their own men in the control tower. Stuart and his men ensure that Esperanza's plane lands safely, and then demand that Stuart and his men be given a fully-fueled 747 and free passage wherever they choose to go. programme.title: Brockmire
programme.sub-title: It All Comes Down to This
programme.desc: It All Comes Down to This. On the Season 1 finale, Brockmire makes a decision. He must choose between staying in Morristown or returning to the major leagues(n)

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: Jennifer Beals stars as Alex Owens, a Pittsburgh steel-mill welder by day, and bar dancer by night. Harboring dreams of a career in ballet, she is given financial support in this endeavor by her boss Nick Hurley (Michael Nouri) and moral support by demanding but big-hearted instructor Hanna Long (Lilia Skala). The film's signature scene is, of course, Alex's water-drenched dance audition, largely performed in long shot by her dance double Marine Jahan. Essentially an old-fashioned backstage yarn, Flashdance was given a contemporary spin by its pulsating, musical score featuring the Oscar-winning Best Song, Flashdance...What a Feeling, (music by Giorgio Moroder, lyrics by Keith Forsey and Irene Cara)(n)

programme.title: Jackie Brown
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's slick third film, based on an Elmore Leonard novel, is a tight thriller centred around blaxploitation star Pam Grier, who plays Jackie Brown, a strong woman approaching the end of her career as an air hostess. She's been trafficking 'hot' money for gangster Ordell Robbie, but when she ends up carrying enough cash to retire on, she decides to fly solo, so long as she can outfox Ordell, the cops and the feds. Also starring Robert Forster, Bridget Fonda and Robert De Niro(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life
programme.desc: As the feisty video-game heroine, Angelina Jolie shifts into overdrive in this high-tech, fast-paced sequel. This time around Lara and her ex, a disgraced British agent turned mercenary, set out to retrieve Pandora's box. An evil scientist wants to use the legendary box to create a biological weapon(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: In Paul Verhoeven's wild sci-fi action movie Total Recall, Arnold Schwarzenegger plays a 21st-century construction worker who discovers that his entire memory of the past derives from a memory chip implanted in his brain. Schwarzenegger learns that he's actually a secret agent who had become a threat to the government, so those in power planted the chip and invented a domestic lifestyle for him. Once he has realized his true identity, he travels to Mars to piece together the rest of his identity, as well as to find the man responsible for his implanted memory. Verhoeven has created a fast, furious action film with Total Recall, filled with impressive stunts and (literally) eye-popping visuals. Though the film bears only a passing resemblance to the Philip K. Dick short story it was based on ("We Can Remember It For You Wholesale"), the movie is an entertaining, if very violent, ride(n)

programme.title: The Tournament
programme.desc: The world's best assassins converge upon the streets of a small Scottish town to compete in a deadly tournament in which the last killer standing gets a million-dollar prize while wealthy thrillseekers watch a live video stream and gamble on the outcome. Robert Carlyle (Trainspotting) stars as a local priest who becomes an unwitting participant in the grisly contest in this adrenaline-fueled action film from director Scott Mann(n)

programme.title: The Punisher
programme.desc: Following the murder of his family at the hands of vicious organised criminals, cop Frank Castle leaves his old life behind to bring bloody justice to those responsible. Action(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Tom Cruise reprises his role as IMF agent Ethan Hunt, master of disguise and the double bluff. In JJ Abrams' fast-faced thriller, he's up against Owen Davian, who is planning to sell a new deadly weapon's system, code-named the 'Rabbit's Foot' to the highest bidder. Cue a stunning helicopter chase through a wind farm, a parachute drop that leaves Hunt dangling in front of a speeding truck and an unholy finale in the Vatican City, bringing the franchise to a punchy conclusion(n)

programme.desc: At 694 metres in height, Pen-y-ghent is the smallest fell on the Yorkshire Three Peaks Challenge, but the dramatic summit affords far-reaching views above the Dales, with plenty of surprises en route. The peak lies 3km east of Horton in Ribblesdale and the Pennine Way links the summit to the village. As Julia reveals, the route is around 5km in length, as the Way curves initially to the north before turning east to reach the summit.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The surly detective tries to get out of attending a reunion of George Cross holders because a serial rapist has struck again on his patch. Righteous indignation prompts him to take the most desperate professional gamble of his entire career by using PC Hazel Wallace as bait in a trap. He eventually picks up a lead involving the most recent victim's father, but comes under pressure from within the force to back down or be thrown off the case. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspected kidnapping and gets his first lead when a ransom note is discovered. The missing woman then turns up dead at the wheel of a crashed car, smelling of alcohol. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Don't Lose Your Head
programme.desc: A cunning English nobleman puts his talent for disguise to good use by rescuing aristocrats from execution during the French Revolution. However, the leader of the secret police is determined to unmask the elusive hero spiriting the nobility out from under the guillotine. Comedy spoof of the Scarlet Pimpernel story, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims, Jim Dale and Charles Hawtrey.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Don't Lose Your Head
programme.desc: A cunning English nobleman puts his talent for disguise to good use by rescuing aristocrats from execution during the French Revolution. However, the leader of the secret police is determined to unmask the elusive hero spiriting the nobility out from under the guillotine. Comedy spoof of the Scarlet Pimpernel story, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims, Jim Dale and Charles Hawtrey.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A clairvoyant at Whitby Funfair gives a bride-to-be cold feet about her imminent nuptials. Meanwhile, Bellamy is persuaded to cover at the pub, and is almost caught serving drinks after hours, while a new policeman in the village is suspected of being an imposter. Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Liz's past catches up with her, and Vernon's dreams of wealth go up in smoke. Meanwhile, Merton receives crime-fighting assistance from an unlikely source - two locals dressed as Batman and Robin, who have spotted criminal activity on a derelict farm.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A friend of Jessica's wins a fortune in a sweepstake - but soon discovers her new-found wealth brings a host of problems in its wake, and realises she can trust no one. Starring Angela Lansbury and Loretta Swit.(n)

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: An independent-minded woman enters a convent and develops a gift for medicine, while struggling to curb her rebellious nature. She is sent to the Congo to assist a doctor in his work, but suffers a crisis of faith at the outbreak of the Second World War. Drama, based on Kathryn C Hulme's novel, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter Finch, Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.(n)

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: An independent-minded woman enters a convent and develops a gift for medicine, while struggling to curb her rebellious nature. She is sent to the Congo to assist a doctor in his work, but suffers a crisis of faith at the outbreak of the Second World War. Drama, based on Kathryn C Hulme's novel, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter Finch, Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Foyle investigates what he believes to be a burglary at the headquarters of a multinational company, and the murder of a Home Guard member during a large-scale exercise on the Sussex Downs soon leads him to believe the firm are conducting covert business with the Nazis - and that his former police sergeant may be involved. Second World War crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Anthony Howell.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Mead's elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin & Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper: Not Like That, Like This
programme.desc: Feature-length biopic of the much-loved comedian, written by Simon Nye and starring David Threlfall. When Tommy's extensive touring starts to affect his home life and his health, his doting wife Gwen, whom he nicknamed Dove, decides she cannot go on the road with him any longer, so he asks stage manager Mary to act as his assistant. Her unwavering support makes all the difference to the star's performances and the pair soon embark on an affair. For the next 17 years, Tommy finds himself unable to choose between these two equally devoted women, and his death on live TV in 1984 means he never makes that decision. With Amanda Redman, Helen McCrory, Jason Manford, Gregor Fisher and Paul Ritter.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: The comedian performs a variety of sketches, with the assistance of guest Vincent Price.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents highlights from Donington Park, featuring the Porsche Carrera Cup GB and the Ginetta Junior Championship.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.sub-title: Isle of Man TT: Preview Show 2.
programme.desc: Craig Doyle presents qualifying action from the prestigious motorcycle event, held on a road course on the Isle of Man. Steve Parrish and Steve Plater analyse the form.(n)

programme.title: BRDC Formula 3 Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the third round of the season at Snetterton, which was set to feature the seventh, eighth and ninth races of the season.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the seventh day's play at Roland Garros, where the third-round singles matches are scheduled to conclude in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. Eventual champion Novak Djokovic ended the run of Great Britain's Aljaz Bedene at this stage last year with a dominant 6-2, 6-3, 6-3 victory. In the women's competition, top seed Serena Williams prevailed 6-4, 7-6 against Kristina Mladenovic, and her sister Venus was also victorious, beating Alize Cornet 7-6, 1-6, 6-0. Meanwhile, 200 champion Ana Ivanovic's run came to an end she was beaten 6-4, 6-4 by Elina Svitolina. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the Superbike TT at the prestigious motorcycling event from the Isle of Man, which saw the riders attempt to complete six laps of the circuit in the quickest time. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Joey: The Man Who Conquered the TT
programme.desc: A profile of Joey Dunlop, the Northern Irish motorcyclist who won 26 races at the Isle of Man TT between 1976 and 2000, before his untimely death at an event in Estonia. With contributions from John McGuinness, Phil McCallen, Brian Reid, Mick Grant, Ron Haslam, Roger Marshall, Jim Dunlop and Neil Tuxworth.(n)

programme.title: Hard Target
programme.desc: A woman searching for her missing father hires an out-of-work merchant sailor to guide her through the streets of New Orleans, where his martial arts skills are greatly tested in a series of encounters with sadistic hunters of human prey. John Woo's action thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Yancy Butler, Lance Henriksen and Wilford Brimley.(n)

programme.desc: Arthur does a profitable deal on a fireplace and Terry has to mind a dodgy bookie, putting a damper on his blossoming romance with latest girlfriend Dolly. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Action from the sixth round of the season, held at Donington Park.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the eighth day's play at Roland Garros, where the fourth-round singles matches are scheduled to get under way in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. Andy Murray continued his run to the final at this stage in 2016 with a 7-6. 6-4. 6-3 victory over John Isner, while 2015 champion Stan Wawrinka defeated Viktor Troicki 7-6, 6-7, 6-3, 6-3, and home favourite Richard Gasquet overcame fifth seed Kei Nishikori 6-4, 6-2, 4.6, 6-2. In the women's competition, eventual champion Garbine Muguruza prevailed 6-3, 6-4 against 2009 title-winner Svetlana Kuznetsova, and Shelby Rogers won by the same scoreline against Irina-Camelia Begu. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.desc: Highlights from the first of two Sidecar TT races at the prestigious motorcycling event from the Isle of Man, which saw the riders attempt to complete three laps of the circuit. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Cycling: Criterium du Dauphine Highlights: 2017 Stage One.
programme.desc: Action from stage one of the UCI World Tour race, featuring a 170.5km route starting and finishing in St Etienne. Presented by Gary Imlach, with commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and reports by Daniel Friebe.(n)

programme.title: World Rugby U20 Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Richard Henwood presents action from the second round of pool fixtures at the tournament in Georgia, including England v Wales, Ireland v Scotland and New Zealand v Italy.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Erica prepares to visit Andrew in Liverpool, leaving locum Nick Goodson in charge of the surgery, where he promptly endangers a patient with a serious misdiagnosis. Meanwhile, David watches dumbfounded as the old folks' outing he's organised is reduced to a shambles by a pair of runaway pensioners in a stolen coach. Drama, starring Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham, Adrian Lukis and Geoffrey Bayldon.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert feels Christine is keeping him at arm's length, while Cathy needs his shoulder to cry on after a weekend in London with Mike leaves her with mixed feelings about their on-off relationship. Jack encourages David to ask for a transfer to surgery, and Stuart makes it clear he wants nothing more to do with Louise. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine doesn't do herself any favours in the popularity stakes, telling Louise she might not have a job to come back to once she has had the baby, and accusing Robert of taking Jack's side in a problematic case. Meanwhile, Kate gets a final warning after leaving a patient choking, and David makes plans for a party in celebration of his move into surgery. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick moves up a rank to Sergeant and Blaketon becomes the new postmaster, while Greengrass threatens revenge on the miscreant responsible for dosing his beloved dog Alfred with rat poison. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass starts a devious plot involving the postal service, much to Blaketon's annoyance, and several people are suspected of attacking a TV repair man. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike has problems when a man held in custody drops dead. Bernie and Greengrass establish a taxi firm and look for ways to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Laurence embarks on another London trip, leaving his lovelorn wife Elizabeth at home. On overhearing a saucy chat between two servants, her uncontrollable jealousy prompts her to sack them both. Gordon Jackson, Nicola Pagett and Ian Ogilvy star.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Robin saves a witch's life and accepts Marion fully into the band of outlaws. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Praed.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Retired couple Hugh and Cecily Branksome settle in the seaside town of their childhood, but their dreams of peace and tranquillity are shattered by the appearance of an old flame of Cecily's. Melancholy drama, starring Janet Suzman, Richard Johnson, Joyce Redman and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Jewel Robbery at the Grand Metropolitan.
programme.desc: On doctor's orders, the dapper Belgian sleuth visits Brighton for what he hopes will be a relaxing holiday, but it leads to one of the most absorbing cases he has ever faced - the disappearance of a cache of jewels. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Hermione Norris, Philip Jackson and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook.
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley (The Bill) and Julie Graham (William and Mary).(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jenny's death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Friend of the Devil - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Cabbot investigates when a woman is found murdered on the moors. As the identity of the victim is established, it becomes apparent any number of suspects may have had a reason to want her dead. Meanwhile, Banks is called in when the body of a teenage girl is discovered in a storage room down an alleyway. Stephen Tompkinson and Andrea Lowe star.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Friend of the Devil - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detective and his team find themselves investigating the murder of one of their own. Cabbot is convinced there is a link between the deaths of Lucy Payne and her colleague, but is dismissed as trying to push her career ambitions. However, after receiving new information from another force, she begins to uncover the real connection between the killings. Andrea Lowe stars.(n)

programme.title: The Level
programme.desc: Mistrustful of her colleagues, Nancy desperately needs an ally - but cannot open up to Hayley for fear of putting them both in danger. When the police make a public appeal hoping to shake out the missing witness, Nancy is unexpectedly forced into the spotlight, leaving her exposed and bringing an old enemy out of the woodwork - Hayley's ex-boyfriend. Meanwhile, the murder investigation focuses on Frank Le Saux's accountant Theo Kettler, whom a witness links to a Newhaven garage suspected of drugs trafficking. Drama, starring Karla Crome, Laura Haddock and Joe Absolom.(n)

programme.title: Marcella
programme.desc: The killer's next victim is a six-year-old girl, which devastates Marcella, and a DNA match gives the police team its strongest lead yet. Meanwhile, DI Tim Williamson investigates Andrew Barnes' death - was it really suicide? Crime drama, starring Anna Friel and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.sub-title: Robin of Sherwood to Prime Suspect.
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates this exploration of links from the new-age mysticism of Robin of Sherwood to the gritty realism of ITV drama series Prime Suspect.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: New clinical director Jack tries to curry favour with Christine by criticising Robert's management skills, while David's first day in surgery doesn't go as well as he'd hoped. Mike returns from London wanting his old job back, but walks straight into a fiery situation with Cathy, who's none too pleased to see him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine grows closer to Jack as her professional relationship with Robert continues to deteriorate, but is under no illusions about what her boss wants from her. Mike realises there are plenty more fish in the sea and vows to have a good time playing the field, and Kate's moonlighting gets her into trouble. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A man caught transporting illegal immigrants panics and holds staff hostage in a bid to avoid any police involvement. Jack takes control of the situation, proving there's more to him than meets the eye, while Andrew is emotionally scarred by the experience. Elsewhere, Sam and Mike make no attempt to deny they're an item when everyone finds out they're sharing a flat. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Kavanagh defends a left-wing activist accused of murdering someone from the opposite end of the political spectrum - and learns a harsh lesson in the process. To make matters worse, he finds out daughter Kate is having an affair with her married tutor, thus setting the scene for further fireworks. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew stops dithering and proposes to Erica, but his mind is soon distracted from romance by the plight of a priest suffering from a mystery illness. While he's wondering what course of action to take, Nick continues his scheming and David becomes increasingly concerned about Clare's mental state, fearing she's about to be overtaken by manic depression again. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham and Adrian Lukis star.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Retired couple Hugh and Cecily Branksome settle in the seaside town of their childhood, but their dreams of peace and tranquillity are shattered by the appearance of an old flame of Cecily's. Melancholy drama, starring Janet Suzman, Richard Johnson, Joyce Redman and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Eternal bachelor Greengrass falls in love with an aristocratic lady poacher, and an old flame of Mike's turns up out of the blue to complicate his life. Rural capers, starring Nick Berry, Natasha Dahlberg and Frances de la Tour.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman is admitted to hospital after a series of burglaries, and Nick and Jo start planning their life together. Greengrass and Bernie try their hand at modern art. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Scandal threatens to engulf Eaton Place as news spreads that James, already heavily in debt, has made one of the Bellamys' servants pregnant. Period drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh and David Langton.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: Walker discovers Zelda's secret and attempts to blackmail her, forcing her into hiding, while Angelique fears Bernhardt has been killed when the British shoot down a number of German planes. James takes Eugene's parents to the site of their son's execution, but Von Rheingarten throws them off the property before befriending Philip, whom he still believes to be a local gardener.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad, as a complex plot by a gang of dangerous dissidents sees a host of international figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: In 1935, beleaguered Bournemouth mother Louisa Durrell decides to uproot her family and build a new life on the sun-drenched island of Corfu. However, with money problems and four unruly children to care for, even a new start might not be enough to banish her troubles. Period drama, starring Keeley Hawes, based on Gerald Durrell's trilogy of Corfu memoirs, which includes My Family and Other Animals.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Laura is publicly disgraced when news of the Bowers' divorce hits the papers, with grave consequences for the surgery and her friendship with Tom. Pat is tempted by her feelings for Marek while Bob is in hospital. Steph is delighted when Stan returns home on leave, but the reunion is overshadowed by his fears of invasion. Frances discovers a secret at the reading of the will.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran.(n)

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Lydia and Ruby visit a convent to make a seemingly miraculous diagnosis, but the treatment of a young nun and the senior doctor's interfering attitude creates tension between them, which finally erupts in a fierce confrontation. Maggie and Paul join a group of pilgrims on a trek through the jungle, hoping to find the answer to their prayers. Guest starring Madhur Jaffrey.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen seizes some emaciated horses that were forced to eat dirt to survive. Two of the mares have foals and are struggling to produce milk to feed them.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to piece together the stories of soldiers who went to war but never returned.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Techniques for the detection of deadly poisons that help solve crime.(n)

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The case of a woman burned to death in her home. Sandy Maloney apparently passed out drunk with a cigarette still in her hands, but detectives began to suspect that her fate was more than just a tragic accident.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The case of 69-year-old Loretta Bowersock, who in December 2004 disappeared while shopping. She was discovered in a shallow grave two years later, as a long-time boyfriend came under suspicion.(n)

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.sub-title: The Murders of WPC Fiona Bone and WPC Nicola Hughes.
programme.desc: How wanted murderer Dale Cregan ambushed and killed two female PCs on a routine callout in Manchester in September 2012. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.sub-title: The Murder of PC Ian Broadhurst.
programme.desc: How the stopping of a suspected stolen car in December 2003 by West Yorkshire Police resulted in the murder of PC Ian Broadhurst by fugitive David Bieber, who was on the run from Florida law enforcement. Bieber had stolen the identity of a dead child in his native United States before fleeing to the UK.(n)

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.desc: Recounting the case of police officers David Wombwell, Christopher Head and Geoffrey Fox, who were killed by hardened criminal Harry Roberts and two associates while patrolling an area of west London in August 1966. Dubbed The Shepherd's Bush Murders, the crime shocked the nation.(n)

programme.title: British Police: George Cross Heroes
programme.desc: The George Cross is the highest award for gallantry for a civilian. Only a select few are prepared to put their lives on the line for the sake of those around them.(n)

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.sub-title: The Murders of WPC Fiona Bone and WPC Nicola Hughes.
programme.desc: How wanted murderer Dale Cregan ambushed and killed two female PCs on a routine callout in Manchester in September 2012. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: British Police Murdered on Duty
programme.sub-title: The Murder of PC Ian Broadhurst.
programme.desc: How the stopping of a suspected stolen car in December 2003 by West Yorkshire Police resulted in the murder of PC Ian Broadhurst by fugitive David Bieber, who was on the run from Florida law enforcement. Bieber had stolen the identity of a dead child in his native United States before fleeing to the UK.(n)

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: The disappearance of married mother Debbie Groseclose. A lack of evidence left police officers mystified and prompted her relatives to seek answers themselves.(n)

programme.title: Inside Homicide
programme.desc: Det Jennifer Mitsch investigates a drug deal that led to a man's death. Meanwhile, Det Summer Benton hunts the killer of a business owner. Documentary following the work and lifestyles of three female murder detectives working in the Cincinnati and Atlanta areas of America.(n)

programme.title: Murder Chose Me
programme.desc: Detective Rod Demery recalls uncovering a fearful secret when the body of a young mother-to-be was found dumped in the shallow waters of a fishing pond.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The case of Miami businessman Henry Diaz, who went missing the night before a family holiday. It transpired his business success had earned him many enemies - even among his own relatives.(n)

programme.title: The Coroner: I Speak for the Dead
programme.desc: A case in which a woman was killed in her backyard. Investigators focused on her family, but it became clear this was a type of assassin by someone killing for the thrill of it.(n)
