programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: (2007) Ethan and Joel Coen's Oscar-laden thriller stars Josh Brolin as Llewelyn Moss, a trailer-dwelling welder and hunter. Hunting deer in the desert, he comes across a drugs exchange which has gone bloodily wrong, and among the detritus is a case containing $2m. He decides to appropriate the money, but it's not a wise move: he soon has the deadly assassin Anton Chigurh (Javier Bardem) on his trail, as well as Sheriff Ed Tom Bell (Tommy Lee Jones), and smiling bounty hunter Carson Wells (Woody Harrelson). As Moss tries to keep hold of the cash, and preserve both his own life and that of his wife Carla (Kelly Macdonald), a deadly game of cat-and-mouse is played out across the Tex-Mex border, as pursuers and the pursued try to gain the upper hand. In English, and Spanish with English subtitles. M,W,S(n)

The murdered boy is able to transform himself into a hi-tech spirit in black leathers who sets out to do battle with a gang of desert-based car thieves led by the man who destroyed him(n)

programme.desc: In this heart-pounding thriller, a Russian Special Forces soldier must escape from a mysterious island where people are harvested for their organs and continue on her quest to rescue her sister(n)

programme.title: Pet
programme.desc: A lonely animal-shelter employee kidnaps a woman he's developed a crush on, and keeps her locked in a cage at his work. However, she is guarding secrets of her own that help her turn the tables on her captor in this twisty, shocking horror flick(n)

programme.title: Saw III
programme.desc: Obsessed with teaching his victims the value of life, a deranged, sadistic serial killer called Jigsaw abducts the morally wayward. But Jigsaw is dying and his apprentice Amanda kidnaps a doctor to keep him alive. Meanwhile, Amanda is playing Jigsaw's deadly game with a new chosen person(n)

programme.title: Saw V
programme.desc: The fifth instalment of the horror franchise reveals how original serial-killer Jigsaw trained Detective Hoffman (Costas Mandylor) to follow in his bloody footsteps as the latest five trapped victims ponder how to survive the deadly puzzles set for them(n)

programme.title: Saw IV
programme.desc: Jigsaw and his apprentice Amanda are dead. Now, upon the news of Detective Kerry's murder, two seasoned FBI profilers, Agent Strahm and Agent Perez, arrive in the terrified community to assist the veteran Detective Hoffman in sifting through Jigsaw's latest grisly remains and piecing together the puzzle(n)

programme.title: The Last Keepers
programme.desc: A teenager learns that she descends from a long line of powerful witches, and strives to embrace her true destiny(n)

programme.title: The Caretaker
programme.desc: Twentysomething Mallorie (Meegan Warner) and her boyfriend August (Sean Martini) must care for her ailing grandmother Birdie (Sondra Blake), who lives alone in a Victorian mansion. However, Birdie's psychic powers soon cause Mallorie to sleepwalk and have terrifying visions. Directed by Jeff Prugh(n)

programme.title: Arthur & Merlin
programme.desc: A banished warrior and a reclusive wizard team up to defend the Celtic people from an invasion by the Saxons in this epic adventure(n)

programme.title: The Roost
programme.desc: Creatures of the night find new prey on the scariest night of the year in this horror story. It's Halloween night, and four friends -- Allison (Vanessa Horneff), Elliott (Wil Horneff), Trevor (Karl Jacob), and Brian (Sean Reid) -- are on a road trip en route to a friend's wedding when their car breaks down after running into something. Looking for help, the four happen upon the farmhouse of an elderly couple, Elvin (Richard Little) and May (Barbara Wilhide), which is located next to a huge barn. Elvin and May have already become lost in the darkness of the barn, and soon two of the lost travelers are suffering the same fate as they search for friendly strangers. However, while they can barely see a hand in front of their face, they discover they're not alone in the barn, which has become home to a huge swarm of bloodthirsty bats. The Roost is framed by an introduction and postscript from a television horror show host, played by Tom Noonan(n)

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: Sparks fly when childhood sweethearts Eisenheim and Sophie are reunited after 15 years. But Sophie is engaged to volatile royal Crown Prince Leopold and he doesn't take kindly to his fiancée's feelings(n)

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A woman acts as a nanny for a life-size doll, which a couple are using as a coping mechanism for the death of their son two decades earlier. However, she soon suspects that there is more to the doll than meets the eye in this disturbing horror film(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Stunning sci-fi drama centering on the story of a police robot named Chappie, who develops the ability to think and feel for himself. As people fight back against the mechanized police force, sinister forces seek to capture Chappie for their nefarious purposes(n)

programme.title: The Wicked Within
programme.desc: In this haunting thriller, a supernatural being torments a family one year after the death of their daughter(n)

programme.title: The Caretaker
programme.desc: Twentysomething Mallorie (Meegan Warner) and her boyfriend August (Sean Martini) must care for her ailing grandmother Birdie (Sondra Blake), who lives alone in a Victorian mansion. However, Birdie's psychic powers soon cause Mallorie to sleepwalk and have terrifying visions. Directed by Jeff Prugh(n)

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A woman acts as a nanny for a life-size doll, which a couple are using as a coping mechanism for the death of their son two decades earlier. However, she soon suspects that there is more to the doll than meets the eye in this disturbing horror film(n)

programme.title: Scar Tissue
programme.desc: A young man and a female cop hunt a serial killer who supposedly died years earlier(n)

programme.title: Attack of the Lederhosen Zombies
programme.desc: In this inventive horror comedy, a group of snowboarders are shocked to discover that the ski resort they're staying at has become infested with zombies. Soon enough, they are forced to fight back against the undead if they want to survive(n)

programme.title: Saw V
programme.desc: The fifth instalment of the horror franchise reveals how original serial-killer Jigsaw trained Detective Hoffman (Costas Mandylor) to follow in his bloody footsteps as the latest five trapped victims ponder how to survive the deadly puzzles set for them(n)

programme.title: HIGH School
programme.desc: After breaking his school's zero-tolerance drug policy, a valedictorian and his stoner buddy steal the local dealer's stash and taint the entire school bake sale to make everyone guilty of the same crime in this rollicking comedy(n)

programme.title: Paranoia
programme.desc: In this relentless psychological thriller, blue-collar worker Adam Cassidy becomes a corporate spy for a ruthless CEO who wants him to infiltrate the competition. In time, Adam realizes that he's being used as a pawn in a much-larger game(n)

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped from production. The superhero reboot would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton(n)

programme.title: Separated
programme.desc: A wind-up toy robot goes on an epic journey to save his better half(n)

programme.title: People Like Us
programme.desc: Businessman Sam returns home for his father's funeral, where he learns he has a sister named Frankie. As Sam connects with Frankie and puts his father's affairs in order, he is forced to reflect on his own life choices in this riveting comedy-drama(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Pilot. In the series premiere, Brian becomes a father after his lesbian-couple friends give birth. He also meets a young and loving 17-year-old who may curb his casual sex life(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Queer, There and Everywhere. Brian's (Gale Harold) new baby is the topic of a conference call between Michael (Hal Sparks), Ted (Scott Lowell), and Emmett (Peter Paige). The three men are all chatting from their jobs, and Ted is simultaneously ogling some internet porn. He quickly puts down the phone when his boss walks into his office. Neither Ted nor Michael is out at work, and Michael even feels compelled to laugh when an obnoxious co-worker makes fun of gay customers. Justin (Randy Harrison) graphically describes his encounter with Brian to his schoolmate, Daphne (Makyla Smith). While Justin is telling Daphne he's in love, Brian is seducing a married man at a business meeting, leading to a quickie in the men's room. Michael, in an effort to conceal his sexual preference, encourages the interest of a pretty female co-worker, Tracy (Lindsey Connell). He's roped into socializing with a small group after work, and Emmett gives him a sports magazine to study, so he'll pass for straight. Brian gets into a tiff with Lindsay (Thea Gill) and Melanie (Michelle Clunie) because they want him to take out a one-million-dollar insurance policy to provide for Gus, their baby boy. That night, Justin comes looking for Brian, who avoids him. Michael feels responsible, and takes Justin to a diner, where he explains to the stricken teen that "Brian doesn't do boyfriends." They're waited on by a wise-cracking middle-aged waitress, Debbie (Sharon Gless of Cagney & Lacey fame), who turns out to be Michael's mom. Michael is in denial about his crush on Brian, but Justin picks up on it quickly. Justin drops in on Brian, interrupting another anonymous tryst. Brian gets over his annoyance long enough to tell Justin, "I don't believe in love."(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.sub-title: No Brits, No Shirt, No Service
programme.desc: No Brits, No Shirt, No Service. Brian shows up late to his son's bris and nearly comes to blows with Melanie; Emmett thinks he's found love with a young Japanese man who speaks no English; and Ted finally gets picked up by a hunky blond(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Ted's Not Dead. When Michael (Hal Sparks), Brian (Gale Harold), and Emmett (Peter Paige) go to visit Ted (Scott Lowell) in the hospital, they learn that he's in a coma and may not recover. Ted's mother, Mrs. Schmidt (Elva Mai Hooper), is understandably distraught to learn that her son was given drugs by a stranger he picked up, who then left him to die. Justin (Randy Harrison) shares detention with a football player he's attracted to, and ends up pleasuring the jock with his hand. Melanie (Michelle Clunie), who happens to be Ted's lawyer, shows up at Brian's office to tell him Ted has named him in a living will, and he's responsible for deciding whether Ted will stay on life support. Brian can't handle the responsibility, and gets into another heated exchange with Mel. Justin reacts badly when his mother (Sherry Miller) calmly confronts him about his sexual preference. Justin runs away and goes looking for Brian. Emmett and Michael go to Ted's apartment to remove all evidence of his lifestyle (e.g. dildos, porn) before Mrs. Schmidt shows up. At Ted's, they find a shrine to Michael. "He collects you the way you collect comics," Emmett points out. Brian goes to the hospital and curses out the comatose Ted before getting it on with an orderly in the next bed. Ted awakens from his coma just in time to hear them going at it. Brian goes to Debbie's (Sharon Gless) to relay the good news, where he finds Justin waiting for him(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Now Approaching... The Line. Justin attends therapy with his mother; Brian "entertains" a client, who's a married man living a double life; Michael gets adjusted by a hunky chiropractor (Chris Potter). Justin: Randy Harrison. Brian: Gale Harold. Michael: Hal Sparks(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: The Art of Desperation. After his big date, Michael (Hal Sparks) is convinced that David (Chris Potter) doesn't like him. Brian (Gale Harold) convinces him to pay another visit to the chiropractor's office. Ted (Scott Lowell), determined to give up club life, finds a speed dating service called Date Bait for gay men over 30, and drags Emmett (Peter Paige) along for company. "I have no desire to have sex with any of them," says Emmett of the assembled men. "Neither do I," answers Ted, "That's a start." He ends up going out with Roger (Darrin Baker), a slightly chubby, bald musician. Michael goes out with David again, and this time, they spend the night together. Ted and Roger go out on a date, but they both seem more interested in the cute waiter than each other. Justin (Randy Harrison) befriends Lindsay (Thea Gill) and Melanie (Michelle Clunie), and after seeing his drawings (including a nude of Brian), Lindsay invites him to participate in an art show at the gay and lesbian center. Michael takes David to a club, and David explains he hasn't been out much because he was with his former boyfriend for six years before he died. Brian meets David, and makes a pass at him while Michael is getting them drinks. At the art show, Justin watches the door and waits for Brian to arrive. When Brian does show up, surprisingly, David suspiciously watches the way he is with Michael. David's jealousy is further aroused when Melanie drunkenly tells him that "Michael and Brian is the greatest love story never told," before she realizes who David is. Jennifer (Sherry Miller) also comes to the show and tries to conceal her shock at Justin's homoerotic work. Ted finally gets horny enough to have sex with Roger, but things don't go well(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Smells Like Codependence. While Justin's mother continues adjusting to the idea that her son is gay, his father has a decidedly unpleasant reaction to the news. Meanwhile, Brian grows increasingly resentful of Michael's relationship. Justin: Randy Harrison. Brian: Gale Harold. Emmett: Peter Paige(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Babylon Boomerang. Justin moves in with Brian after his father kicks him out of the house; Michael continues to deceive a lovesick fellow employee by going out on a date with her. Ted: Scott Lowell(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Daddy Dearest (Sonny Boy). Emmett (Peter Paige) is becoming obsessive about cybersex, but his online persona is that of a muscular "top," so he can't meet any of the people he has sex with on his computer. When baby Gus comes down with a fever, Lindsay (Thea Gill) and Melanie (Michelle Clunie) rush him to the hospital, but Mel not being Gus' birth mother or his legal guardian, is not allowed into the emergency room. On top of that, she has a verbal altercation with a homophobic desk nurse. She wants to petition for second parent adoption, but first Brian (Gale Harold) has to relinquish his parental rights. Emmett is unnerved when he has visions of his hunky screen name, Pitts9x6 (Steve Boyle), coming to life and ordering him around, trying to make him more like his fantasy self. Michael (Hal Sparks) is nervous about a dinner party at David's (Chris Potter), and has the gang give him a crash course in table manners. It turns out to be an awkward affair, and only gets worse when Michael realizes, and announces, that one of the other guests once gave him an STD. Brian, after agreeing to give up parental rights to Gus, goes to visit his own father (Lawrence Dane), a broken-down drunk who doesn't know Brian is gay, and borrows money from his son. He says that Brian is just like him, and was never meant to settle down. The dinner party has Michael thinking that he and David are going to break up, but David has very different plans. This episode was directed by John Greyson (Zero Patience)(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Queens of the Road. David (Chris Potter) wants Michael (Hal Sparks) to move in, and tells Michael about his domestic fantasies, but Michael's not ready to give him an answer. Lindsay (Thea Gill) decides that she doesn't want to go back to work when her maternity leave is up, sending Melanie (Michelle Clunie) scrambling for a way to make living on a single income financially feasible. Justin (Randy Harrison) goes home for his little sister's birthday party, and Jennifer (Sherry Miller) tries to get him to stay, but he knows his father won't accept who he is. Brian (Gale Harold) comes home to find that his apartment has been robbed because Justin failed to turn on his alarm system. He angrily throws Justin out. A cross-dressing psychic uses a Ouja board to tell Michael that Brian is his true love. Then Justin's friend, Daphne (Makyla Smith), shows up to tell the gang that Justin has run away to New York, and they soon learn that he's using Brian's credit card. Michael cancels his dinner plans with David, Lindsay, and Melanie to join Brian, Emmett (Peter Paige), and Ted (Scott Lowell) on a road trip to New York to track Justin down. Out on the road, Brian tells Michael that he'll miss being with him if he moves in with David. When they return to Pittsburgh, Justin moves in with Debbie (Sharon Gless), taking Michael's old room, and Michael gives David his answer(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Surprise!. Emmett (Peter Paige) and Ted (Scott Lowell) are in a drugstore when Ted spots a guy he once had sex with. Then they overhear the man discussing his HIV medication with the pharmacist, sending Ted into a panic. The next day, Emmett and Ted go to get tested. Debbie (Sharon Gless) gives Michael (Hal Sparks) a hard time over his breakup with David (Chris Potter). She then goes to visit Brian (Gale Harold), telling him, "You've ruined my kid's life." Brian says he'll make it up by throwing a surprise birthday party for Michael's upcoming 30th birthday. He even invites David. Ted gets good news from the doctor's office, but Emmett gets a message telling him to come to the office first thing Monday, leaving him fearing the worst. At Michael's "surprise" birthday party, David's gift of an expensive watch can't compete with Brian having "Captain Astro" himself show up with a rare and valuable comic book for Michael. Ted chastises Brian, and tells him to let Michael go, and Brian petulantly tells Ted that everyone know he's in love with Michael. Emmett makes a pact with God, promising to give up sex with men in exchange for being HIV negative. The biggest surprise of the night comes when Tracy (Lindsey Connell) shows up at the party, and Brian outs Michael to her, sending a shocked and heartbroken Michael back into the arms of David(n)

programme.title: People Like Us
programme.desc: Businessman Sam returns home for his father's funeral, where he learns he has a sister named Frankie. As Sam connects with Frankie and puts his father's affairs in order, he is forced to reflect on his own life choices in this riveting comedy-drama(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Black
programme.desc: A recent college graduate becomes entangled in a peculiar sexual relationship with a wealthy businessman in this parody of "Fifty Shades of Grey."(n)

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Making Pet Sounds
programme.desc: Brian Wilson and the surviving members of The Beach Boys revisit the writing and recording of their landmark 1967 album "Pet Sounds" to celebrate the 50th anniversary of its release(n)

programme.title: The Day
programme.desc: A small band of friends make an uneasy alliance with a mysterious lone wolf in this blend of horror and adventure. An unnamed catastrophe has turned the Earth into a wasteland, and as packs of feral cannibals wander the countryside, a dwindling number of survivors struggle to stay alive. Rick (Dominic Monaghan), Adam (Shawn Ashmore), Henson (Cory Hardrict), and Shannon (Shannyn Sossamon) have been journeying together for months and are the last living members of a much larger group. Mary (Ashley Bell) is a solitary woman who crossed paths with the survivors and is now traveling with them. She isn't interested in discussing her past or becoming friends, but the others learn she's a powerful ally in a fight. The travelers take shelter in a house, but are soon surrounded by cannibals; they quickly realize just how strong a warrior Mary can be, while also discovering the terrible truth that led her to wander alone. The Day was directed by Douglas Aarniokoski, who has accumulated extensive credits as an assistant director and helming second-unit material on major films(n)

programme.title: The Roost
programme.desc: Creatures of the night find new prey on the scariest night of the year in this horror story. It's Halloween night, and four friends -- Allison (Vanessa Horneff), Elliott (Wil Horneff), Trevor (Karl Jacob), and Brian (Sean Reid) -- are on a road trip en route to a friend's wedding when their car breaks down after running into something. Looking for help, the four happen upon the farmhouse of an elderly couple, Elvin (Richard Little) and May (Barbara Wilhide), which is located next to a huge barn. Elvin and May have already become lost in the darkness of the barn, and soon two of the lost travelers are suffering the same fate as they search for friendly strangers. However, while they can barely see a hand in front of their face, they discover they're not alone in the barn, which has become home to a huge swarm of bloodthirsty bats. The Roost is framed by an introduction and postscript from a television horror show host, played by Tom Noonan(n)

programme.title: The Howling Reborn
programme.desc: A high school senior learns he descends from a long line of werewolves, and attempts to choose between embracing his inner-beast and holding on to his humanity as the long-running horror franchise returns. Will Kidman (Landon Liboiron) is your typical teenager; he's got an eye for girls, and lately his gaze has been lingering on a gorgeous classmate (Lindsey Shaw). Meanwhile, an enigmatic woman (Ivana Milicevic) from Will's distant past resurfaces with a shocking revelation: Will's ancestors were lycanthropes, and now he will inherit the secrets of their incredible power. But when Will realizes that embracing his destiny will spell certain death for the girl he loves, he prepares to make a choice that could spell the end of his monstrous bloodline, and incur the wrath of the very creatures that have claimed him as one of their own(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dogs
programme.desc: A talking dog helps his owner overcome a corrupt bussiness man who wants to tear down his restaurant and build a golf course(n)

programme.title: Song One
programme.desc: On the heels of her Oscar win for Les Misérables, Anne Hathaway takes the leading role in this drama centered on the burgeoning relationship between a young woman and her sickly brother's favorite musician. Emerging filmmaker Kate Barker-Froyland adapts her own screenplay to make her feature directorial debut with this Worldview Entertainment film(n)

programme.title: Mother's Day
programme.desc: A young woman tries to find her biological mom in this ensemble comedy about Mother's Day. Elsewhere, a divorced mother of two falls for a guy with two kids of his own, and an overstressed mom is visited by her bickering parents(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Move It or Lose It. Michael finally moves in with David, but discovers that he and the good doctor have less in common than he thought. Meanwhile, Lindsay and Melanie's relationship becomes strained; and Emmett tries to stay on the straight and narrow(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Very Stupid People. Brian (Gale Harold) is impressed with Kip (Barna Moricz), a creative newcomer to his ad agency. Lindsay (Thea Gill) and Melanie (Michelle Clunie) attend a baby shower for another lesbian couple, where Marianne (Angela Asher) matches her cynical wit with Melanie, and flirts with her. Matt (Joseph Scoren) tells Emmett (Peter Paige) that if he really wants to "See the Light," he'll eventually have to drop the friends who lead him into temptation. Kip asks to work with Brian, and aggressively comes onto him. Brian lets Kip know who's in charge, then has sex with him on his desk. Emmett is reluctantly discarding his gay porn collection, when Ted (Scott Lowell) and Michael (Hal Sparks) come by. They scoff at Emmett's decision to explore the part of himself that's not gay. Mel goes out for a cigarette and ends up telling Marianne her problems, just before sleeping with her. She immediately feels guilty and has to tell Lindsay about it. Ted and Michael meet porn star Zack O'Tool (Matthew G. Taylor), and Ted pays the well-endowed actor to pay a visit to Emmett and change his mind about ditching his sexuality. Their foolproof plot fails. Kip is after a promotion, but Brian refuses his request for a recommendation because he doesn't think Kip is ready. Kip feels like Brian owes him, and ends up suing Brian and the ad agency for sexual harassment(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: A Change of Heart. Brian (Gale Harold) is sent home from work until the harassment suit is settled. Emmett (Peter Paige) meets Heather (Tracy Waterhouse), a would-be former lesbian, at "See the Light," and she shares his desire to have a breakthrough with the opposite sex. She asks him out. Michael's (Hal Sparks) evening at home with David (Chris Potter) is interrupted when Ted (Scott Lowell) calls with news of Brian's new money worries. A perturbed David demands that Michael refrain from getting involved in Brian's problems. Brian asks Melanie (Michelle Clunie), who has left Lindsay (Thea Gill), to represent him in the lawsuit. Melanie has a few ideas on how to handle the case. "It might just be amusing to have you indebted to me for the rest of your life," Melanie tells him. Melanie takes Ted to the movies, where they run into Emmett and Heather. Ted wants to get together with Emmett, so Emmett invites him to a "See the Light" meeting. David catches Michael lying to him about spending time with Brian. Brian later pays a visit to David and lets him know that he'll lose Michael if he tries to control him. Emmett and Heather use same-sex fantasies to get through the uncomfortable business of having hetero sex. Justin(Randy Harrison) uses his youthful charm in an effort to get Kip (Barna Moricz) to drop his lawsuit. Ted shows up at "See the Light" with Michael, and tells Emmett that God created him in His image, and that He doesn't make mistakes(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: The Ties That Bind. Lindsay (Thea Gill) goes out of town for a teacher's conference, and because Melanie (Michelle Clunie) is also away, she leaves Gus with Brian (Gale Harold). David's (Chris Potter) son, Hank (Ryan Cooley), is coming for a visit, and Michael (Hal Sparks) is nervous about meeting the boy. Brian's father, Jack (Lawrence Dane), pops in and tells Brian that he has cancer, and doesn't have long to live. Michael tries to make conversation with Hank, but the boy tells him he doesn't even want to be there -- his mother made him visit. Brian brings Gus over to Debbie's (Sharon Gless) and asks her to baby-sit so he can go to the Leather Ball. She has to work, so Brian makes other arrangements. When Debbie hears about Brian's dad, she tries to convince Brian to tell Jack that he's gay. Ted (Scott Lowell) recognizes an old friend from business school, Dale (Bobby Johnston), who happens to be decked out in leather, whipping a willing slave. Dale invites Ted to his place, but Ted freaks out when Dale invites him to relinquish control. Later Ted realizes how predictable he is, and reconsiders. When Melanie gets wind of Lindsay's babysitting arrangements, she comes home early, only to find Justin (Randy Harrison) about to give the baby hot milk. She lets Brian have it when he gets home. When David leaves on an emergency call, Hank tells Brian that he doesn't have a problem with his dad being gay -- he just can't relax with him, because David makes plans for every minute of every visit. The two ditch David's itinerary and spend a fun afternoon reading comics. Brian comes out to Jack, who reacts badly. But later, he goes to visit Brian again, and learns that he has a grandson(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: French Fried. Michael (Hal Sparks) and David (Chris Potter) appear to be living an idyllic life as a couple, but Michael is frustrated with David's insistence on paying for everything. Mel (Michelle Clunie) goes to Babylon with Ted (Scott Lowell) and Emmett (Peter Paige) for "Dyke Night," but every woman there seems to remind her of Lindsay (Thea Gill). Justin (Randy Harrison) brags to Brian (Gale Harold) about his SAT scores, and all the Ivy League schools he could attend. Brian seems concerned about Justin going to school out of state, and Justin teases him for revealing that he cares. At school, Justin intercedes when homophobe Chris Hobbs (Alec McClure) taunts another student and gets into a scuffle. The teacher blames Justin, who curses him out, earning a suspension. Debbie (Sharon Gless) suggests Justin try to educate the people at his school. Mel goes to see Lindsay, and is shocked when a snooty French guy, Guillaume (Noam Jenkins) answers the door, and won't let her in to see Gus. Brian is also concerned when Mel tells him about it. They don't feel any better when they find out Lindsay plans to marry Guillaume for immigration reasons. Michael finds out the checks he's been giving David for their expenses haven't been cashed, and confronts him. David agrees that they should only do things they both can afford, before revealing that he had planned a surprise weeklong trip to Paris. Michael suddenly feels conflicted. Justin and Daphne (Makyla Smith), with help from Debbie and Brian start a "Gay-Straight Student Alliance" at school, but the principal stops the meeting because they didn't go through "proper channels." Justin has another encounter with Chris on the street, and reveals a humiliating secret about him. This episode was directed by Jeremy Podeswa (The Five Senses)(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.sub-title: Solution (How TLFKAM Got Her Name Back)
programme.desc: Solution (How TLFKAM Got Her Name Back). Michael (Hal Sparks) shows the gang his slides from Paris, and they're all bored. David (Chris Potter) is hosting a political fundraiser for Senator Diane Baxter (Barbara Gordon), and Michael, worried that his friends and family will embarrass him, decides not to invite them. Just when Ted (Scott Lowell) and Emmett (Peter Paige) are complaining that Michael is changing, he shows up with the gold Miata that David just bought him. Then they find out David's holding some kind of party. Guillaume (Noam Jenkins) gets his deportation letter, so he and Lindsay (Thea Gill) plan to get married quickly. Brian (Gale Harold) tells Lindsay that she's marrying the wrong person. She tells him that her and Mel (Michelle Clunie) are through. Brian also pays a visit to Michael, just to let him know that he's become a "little snot." Justin's (Randy Harrison) locker is vandalized at school. Jennifer (Sherry Miller) talks to the principal, Dr. Perkins (John Bourgeois), who isn't sympathetic, and won't let Justin start a Gay-Straight Alliance at the school. Uncle Vic (Jack Wetherall) sees a newspaper story about David's fundraiser and shows it to the gang. Michael still won't invite them, and angrily tells Debbie (Sharon Gless) it's not her thing. After Michael leaves, Brian gets out his checkbook, and the gang dresses to the nines (Emmett in drag, Ted in leather) and crashes the party. The party gets a little crazy. The senator doesn't seem to mind, but Michael has a fit and yells at Debbie. Later, Brian runs into Guillaume at the supermarket. The Frenchman insults Brian, and tells him he plans to adopt Gus, spurring Brian into drastic action. Justin holds a rally at school to save his club, and Dr. Perkins seems ready to expel Justin, until the "guest of honor" shows up(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Surprise Kill. Brian spots David in a compromising situation, forcing David to have a discussion with Michael. Meanwhile, Justin is weighing his university options and tries to cope with sad news about his parents(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Good Grief!. Brian (Gale Harold) is in the middle of a three-way when he gets a phone call. The news that his father died doesn't slow him down. The boys are hanging out at the diner later when Brian nonchalantly gives them the news. Justin (Randy Harrison) finds out that Daphne (Makyla Smith) has a boyfriend. She's worried about having sex for the first time, and wants someone experienced, namely Justin, to deflower her. Michael (Hal Sparks) thinks Brian should be with his family, but can't drag him out of Babylon. Ted (Scott Lowell) runs into Blake (Dean Armstrong), apologizes for accusing him of stealing his wallet, and tells him to come see him if he ever needs anything. Blake shows up at Ted's later, swears he's clean, and asks to stay. Brian finds his father's treasured bowling ball while preparing for the funeral. His sister, Claire (Kirsten Kieferle), asks people to share their memories of Dad at the reception. Brian remembers that Jack told his mother to get an abortion when she was pregnant with him. Justin and Daphne nervously prepare to copulate. Justin tells her, "Afterwards, let's not get weird." Emmett (Peter Paige) continues to chide Ted for trusting Blake. Ted accuses Emmett of being jealous. Emmett later catches Blake talking to a dealer, and warns him to stay away from Ted. After the funeral, Brian drunkenly comes on to Michael, who rejects his advances. Later, Daphne tells Justin that she broke up with her boyfriend, and she's also told her friends about what happened between them. When Justin makes it clear that he was only doing her a favor when they had sex, a rift forms between them. Blake disappears, and Ted goes on a frantic search for him. Brian pays a special tribute to his departed father(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: The King of Babylon. The gang is talking about tonight's King of Babylon contest. David (Chris Potter) doesn't want to go, but he changes his mind when Michael (Hal Sparks) tells him how everyone makes jokes about his age. When they get to the club, Blake (Dean Armstrong) is immediately approached by Dino (Peter Charles Nurse), his old dealer, who offers him crystal meth. Blake insists to Ted (Scott Lowell) that he can handle the pressure of being at the club. Brian (Gale Harold) continues to take Justin (Randy Harrison) for granted. Meanwhile, Uncle Vic (Jack Wetherall) spurns the advances of a man in the mall men's room. Emmett (Peter Paige) meets and instantly falls in love with Brent (Dave Tomlinson) in a moment straight out of West Side Story. When Brian hears David complaining about gay culture's obsession with youth and beauty, he accuses David of being jealous, and David tries to goad Brian into entering the strip contest. Blake steps away, and Ted walks off, angry at everyone, especially Michael, for not giving Blake a chance. Debbie (Sharon Gless) gets an urgent call from Vic, who's been arrested for indecent exposure. She goes to Melanie (Michelle Clunie) for help. The contest hostess, Sheba (Salvatore Migliore), sees Justin pouting and offers to help him teach Brian a lesson. Everyone thinks Brian signed up for the contest, but he actually entered David's name. David takes him up on the challenge. Mel and Debbie get to the police station, where the homophobic desk sergeant won't let them see Vic. Desperate to raise bail for him, they head to Babylon. In a scene straight out of The Way We Were, Emmett and Brent break up. Justin competes in the King of Babylon contest, winning over the crowd, including the guy Brian was about to have sex with(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Running to Stand Still. Brian receives a prestigious professional award and ponders a move to New York City; Vic faces the music in court; and Blake tries to become a productive member of society(n)

programme.title: Queer as Folk
programme.desc: Full Circle. Michael has second thoughts about moving to Portland with David; Ted realizes that he's unable to help Blake kick drugs; Justin and Daphne attend their high-school prom, which proves to be an unforgettable experience. Michael: Hal Sparks. David: Chris Potter. Ted: Scott Lowell. Brian: Gale Harold(n)

programme.title: Mother's Day
programme.desc: A young woman tries to find her biological mom in this ensemble comedy about Mother's Day. Elsewhere, a divorced mother of two falls for a guy with two kids of his own, and an overstressed mom is visited by her bickering parents(n)

programme.title: Tale of Tales
programme.desc: This fantasy epic adapts three fairy tales by 17th century Neapolitan writer Giambattista Basile, each one focusing on the royalty in neighboring kingdoms. In one, a king (John C. Reilly) goes off to cut the heart out of a sea monster, which could be the key to curing his wife (Salma Hayek) of infertility; in another, a dim-witted ruler (Toby Jones) neglects his daughter's search for a husband as he becomes obsessed with a flea that grows to enormous size; in the last tale, an oversexed monarch (Vincent Cassel) is bewitched by an elderly woman with a beautiful singing voice. Directed by Matteo Garrone (Gomorrah)(n)

programme.title: Bad Ass 2: Bad Asses
programme.desc: Bullets fly and bodies drop in this sequel that finds Vietnam Veteran Frank Vega (Danny Trejo) training young boxers at an East L.A. community center. Despite doing his best to maintain a peaceful existence in a city overrun by crime, Frank is pulled back into the fray after his top student is murdered. Convinced that the killer still lurks in the city's criminal underbelly, Frank recruits his best friend Bernie (Danny Glover) that they're not too old to mete out a little vigilante justice. Unfortunately their quest for vengeance soon leads them to a powerful criminal who uses his diplomatic immunity to evade justice. Unfortunately for him, diplomatic immunity doesn't quite carry the same protection as a bullet proof vest, and before long Frank and Bernie have their slippery target running scared(n)

As the writer uncovers facts that corroborate these suspicions, he begins to fear he might be killed, just like the man who worked on the memoirs before him. Directed by Roman Polanski. Pierce Brosnan, Tom Wilkinson, Olivia Williams(n)

programme.desc: Adaptation of Dumas's classic tale of injustice and intrigue in the Napoleonic era. Sailor Edmond Dantes is unjustly accused of being a political traitor, betrayed by his best friend over a girl and imprisoned for 13 years in the infamous Chateau d'If. When he finally makes good his escape, Dantes plans to exact sweet revenge on his persecutors(n)

programme.desc: In this relentless psychological thriller, blue-collar worker Adam Cassidy becomes a corporate spy for a ruthless CEO who wants him to infiltrate the competition. In time, Adam realizes that he's being used as a pawn in a much-larger game(n)

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Director Kathryn Bigelow's Iraq War-set action thriller presents the conflict in the Middle East from the perspective of those who witnessed the fighting firsthand -- the soldiers. As an elite Army Explosive Ordnance Disposal team tactfully navigates the streets of present-day Iraq, they face the constant threat of death from incoming bombs and sharp-shooting snipers. In Baghdad, roadside bombs are a common danger. The Army is working to make the city a safer place for Americans and Iraqis, so when it comes to dismantling IEDs (improvised explosive devices) the Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) crew is always on their game. But protecting the public isn't easy when there's no room for error, and every second spent dismantling a bomb is another second spent flirting with death. Now, as three fearless bomb technicians take on the most dangerous job in Baghdad, it's only a matter of time before one of them gets sent to "the hurt locker." Starring Jeremy Renner, Guy Pearce, and Ralph Fiennes(n)

programme.desc: (2007) Ethan and Joel Coen's Oscar-laden thriller stars Josh Brolin as Llewelyn Moss, a trailer-dwelling welder and hunter. Hunting deer in the desert, he comes across a drugs exchange which has gone bloodily wrong, and among the detritus is a case containing $2m. He decides to appropriate the money, but it's not a wise move: he soon has the deadly assassin Anton Chigurh (Javier Bardem) on his trail, as well as Sheriff Ed Tom Bell (Tommy Lee Jones), and smiling bounty hunter Carson Wells (Woody Harrelson). As Moss tries to keep hold of the cash, and preserve both his own life and that of his wife Carla (Kelly Macdonald), a deadly game of cat-and-mouse is played out across the Tex-Mex border, as pursuers and the pursued try to gain the upper hand. In English, and Spanish with English subtitles. M,W,S(n)

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Old-fashioned yarn about a band of adventurous kids who take on the might of a property developing company which plans to destroy their home to build a country club. When the children discover an old pirate map in the attic, they follow it into an underground cavern in search of lost treasure. But the old pirate who had drawn the map planted plenty of dangerous obstacles along the way. From a story by Steven Spielberg(n)

programme.title: Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: When hotel handyman Skeeter Bronson begins babysitting his niece and nephew, together they devise wacky bedtime stories. After some strange events, he begins to believe that his stories are coming true and starts trying to use them to right the wrongs of long ago, but he then realises that it is only the madcap contributions of the children that become reality. Can he survive their imaginations? Starring Adam Sandler, Keri Russell, Russell Brand, Guy Pearce, Richard Griffiths, Teresa Palmer(n)

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: Spectacular, screwball sci-fi comedy with Tommy Lee Jones and 'Fresh Prince' Will Smith about highly-skilled, secretive shady characters. They're the agents who regulate the aliens who have settled on Earth, and ensure that they remain undetected. New recruit J and his partner K must find and stop an intergalactic terrorist bent on assassinating two ambassadors from opposing galaxies before they can make peace(n)

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Bar Rescue

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: The Lost Episode. Taffer takes on a quick-tempered New Jersey bar owner with a penchant for kicking out both customers and employees(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.sub-title: Beer and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: Beer and Loathing in Las Vegas. Documentary series in which Jon Taffer tries to turn round the fortunes of some ailing bars. Jon tries to hammer out the relationship problems of two classically trained chef-owners at a struggling blue-collar bar in Las Vegas(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Barely Above Water. Jon tries to turn one failing joint into two successful ones, while also finding time to patch up the owners' marriage(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Second Base, Third Strike. The first-ever re-rescue sees Jon deal with a disengaged owner who's let his bar fall apart again(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Taxed Out in Texas. Jon visits Bryant's Ice House, a biker bar with a bad reputation and an even worse location owned by an inexperienced former tax accountant(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Brokedown Palace. Jon is joined by actors Alexander Siddig and Iddo Goldberg as he takes on a Moroccan bar suffering from an identity crisis(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Thugs With Mugs. The crew is attacked in a brawl at a New York sports bar discovered by customers to be ripping them off(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Sour Lemons and Bitter Business. A failing Ohio burger bar and its bitter owners get a visit from Taffer(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Gone in a Flash. Jon faces a timid owner who has been ignoring promiscuous behavior from her staff(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Chase Lounge. Jon helps a father and son run their bar more efficiently after the son fails to act as bar manager and the father struggles to run the day-to-day operations(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: Scary Mary's. The owner of a struggling Texas dive crosses the line with one of Taffer's experts(n)

programme.title: Bar Rescue
programme.desc: A Bar Full of Bull. Jon tries to bail out a bar in New England's whaling community that has a faulty mechanical bull ride as its centrepiece(n)

programme.title: The Big Hit
programme.desc: Four expert hit men blast their way into a slave trader's stronghold, gaining the favor of a powerful mob boss. But when they kidnap a young heiress who happens to be the boss's goddaughter, they soon become targets themselves. A hard-hitting action-thriller executive produced by John Woo. Mark Wahlberg, Lou Diamond Phillips, Christina Applegate, Antonio Sabato Jr., Lela Rochon(n)

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: A backup quarterback at a West Texas high school steps in for the injured starter and clashes with the gung ho coach(n)

programme.title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
programme.desc: A disillusioned Israeli counter-terrorist soldier fakes his own death in order to fulfil his dream of becoming a New York hairdresser, but his past soon catches up with him(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: The Meltdown
programme.desc: Carlos Saldanha's sequel to the incredibly successful original animation reunites the three unlikely friends, Manny the mammoth (voiced by Ray Romano), Sid the sloth and Diego the sabre-toothed tiger as they are forced to leave the safety of the valley, which is threatened by a melting glacier. But their trek to safety is complicated as Manny discovers a mate, Ellie, Diego confronts his fear of water and Sid is crowned the sacrificial king of a secret sloth society(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart is a single suburban dad trying to make ends meet as a security officer at the local mall. But when Santa's helpers at the mall stage a coup, shutting down the megaplex and taking shoppers hostage, Jersey's most formidable mall cop starts acting like a real police officer to save the day(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: An Army grunt is cryogenically frozen as part of a military experiment, but is forgotten for 500 years. He wakes up to an almost unrecognisable world(n)

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: The FilmFour funded Trainspotting is acknowledged to be one of the most original films to come out of Britain in the last decade. The multi-award-winning film based on Irvine Welsh's novel, stars Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Robert Carlyle, Kelly Macdonald and Kevin McKidd in a story of drugs, survival, scams, friendship and tragedy(n)

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: Ashley Judd is the woman set up for her husband's murder. In jail, she survives by clinging to the knowledge that she cannot be tried for the same crime twice. Revenge on her husband may yet be possible(n)

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Two Kings. A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, creating a rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage as she faces an impossible choice and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat(n)

programme.desc: Lemon Scented You. Trying to work things out with his dead and unfaithful wife, Shadow's reunion is interrupted when he and Mr. Wednesday are kidnapped by the New Gods(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Biopic of country-music legend Johnny Cash, focusing primarily on the long courtship he had with June Carter. programme.title: The Perfect Guy
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller successful lobbyist Leah Vaughn (Sanaa Lathan) jumps into a new relationship with a stranger (Michael Ealy) shortly after breaking up with her noncommittal boyfriend. programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in a superb political thriller set during the Cuban missile crisis in October 1962. JFK is under enormous pressure as he fights to avoid a nuclear war. Dir: Roger Donaldson(n)

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Two Kings. A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, creating a rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage as she faces an impossible choice and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Fast-paced action and adventure as Gail, a whitewater rafting guide, and her family pick up two strangers on a rafting trip(n)

programme.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens
programme.desc: In this thrilling continuation of the epic space opera, an ex-stormtrooper, a scrappy desert dweller and a droid companion embark on a journey that brings them face-to-face with heroes from the past, who are now battling a fascist regime called the First Order(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: Science fiction adventure in which a futuristic, militarised Earth is threatened by regiments of giant insects from outer space. When an idealistic teenager enlists in the army in order to become a citizen, he is put through a brutal training programme to prepare him for the horrors of war. Sent to the distant planet Klendaathu, he and his fellow troopers fight the deadly enemy force(n)

programme.title: Bucky Larson: Born to Be a Star
programme.desc: Adam Sandler co-writes and produces this Columbia Pictures comedy starring Nick Swardson as Bucky Larson, a nerd from nowhere who heads out West to become a porn star after finding out his parents were ones themselves. Upon arriving in Hollywood, a waitress (Christina Ricci) with self-esteem issues gets him situated in the slightly less seedy part of town. Meanwhile, Bucky connects with a friend of his parents, Miles Deep (Don Johnson), who pities the backwards man-child and gives him a shot in the world of porn - only to discover that he's severely lacking in both experience and manliness. Through sheer luck, the footage of Bucky becomes a viral hit on the internet and he is propelled to the top of the adult film business, irking the current king of porn actors, Dick Shadow (Stephen Dorff), who'll do anything to not be in the shadow of the small time fool. The Hot Chick's Tom Brady handled directing duties(n)

programme.title: When the Bough Breaks
programme.desc: A young woman agrees to be the surrogate for a married couple, but she soon becomes infatuated with the household's father-to-be in this blend of horror and erotic drama. Although she initially seems stable and normal during an introduction with would-be parents John (Morris Chestnut) and Laura (Regina Hall), Anna (Jaz Sinclair) grows fixated on John and is willing to do whatever it takes to seduce him. Directed by Jon Cassar(n)

programme.title: Sabrina
programme.desc: Romantic drama about a teenage girl who falls for a handsome, wealthy man from afar - only to find herself capturing his eye when she blossoms into a beautiful young woman(n)

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: Scientists scramble to stop a giant comet that is threatening to destroy Earth in this drama(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: After taking a job at a vacation community, a teen (Nick Jonas) has an affair with the wife of an abusive investment banker (Isabel Lucas). However, their tryst leads to both of them being entangled in a murder. Dermot Mulroney co-stars. Directed by Elizabeth Allen(n)

programme.title: When the Bough Breaks
programme.desc: A young woman agrees to be the surrogate for a married couple, but she soon becomes infatuated with the household's father-to-be in this blend of horror and erotic drama. Although she initially seems stable and normal during an introduction with would-be parents John (Morris Chestnut) and Laura (Regina Hall), Anna (Jaz Sinclair) grows fixated on John and is willing to do whatever it takes to seduce him. Directed by Jon Cassar(n)

programme.title: My Blind Brother
programme.desc: A slacker named Bill (Nick Kroll) lives in the shadow of his vastly more successful brother Robbie (Adam Scott), an athlete whose achievements are made even more impressive due to the fact that he's blind. When the pair both fall for the same woman (Jenny Slate), Bill is forced compete against his arrogant, narcissistic sibling for the first time. Zoe Kazan co-stars. Written and directed by Sophie Goodhart(n)

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: Scientists scramble to stop a giant comet that is threatening to destroy Earth in this drama(n)

programme.title: We Own the Night
programme.desc: By-the-book cops-and-robbers thriller about a shady Brooklyn nightclub owner (Joaquin Phoenix) who clashes with his police-chief father (Robert Duvall) and cop brother (Mark Wahlberg) in 1988. Eva Mendes, Antoni Corone, Moni Moshonov. Written and directed by James Gray(n)

programme.title: When the Bough Breaks
programme.desc: A young woman agrees to be the surrogate for a married couple, but she soon becomes infatuated with the household's father-to-be in this blend of horror and erotic drama. Although she initially seems stable and normal during an introduction with would-be parents John (Morris Chestnut) and Laura (Regina Hall), Anna (Jaz Sinclair) grows fixated on John and is willing to do whatever it takes to seduce him. Directed by Jon Cassar(n)

programme.title: Righteous Kill
programme.desc: Thriller about two New York detectives. When a child rapist and killer escapes justice, detective Turk disregards the rule book and frames him for a murder he did not commit. Almost immediately, somebody begins murdering the city's criminals one by one, and Turk and his partner Rooster are the investigators(n)

programme.title: Soul Plane
programme.desc: Two entrepreneurs start an airline that caters to a black clientele(n)

programme.title: Pandorum
programme.desc: After awakening from hyper-sleep with no memory of their mission, astronauts Lt. Payton and Cpl. Bower discover that the 60,000 passengers aboard their vast spacecraft have vanished without a trace(n)

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: In an attempt to save the family shoe factory from financial ruin, new boss Charlie creates a line of sexy footwear that's modelled by Simon, a vivacious cross-dresser with perfect feet. British comedy from the creator of Calendar Girls(n)

programme.title: Scenic Route
programme.desc: Two longtime friends who have grown apart struggle to survive after their pickup truck breaks down in the desert(n)

programme.title: Hysteria
programme.desc: Set in Victorian London, Tanya Wexler's period comedy Hysteria tells the tale of Mortimer Granville (Hugh Dancy), a young doctor disturbed by the way most hospitals ignore the latest research on germ theory, and still treat patients with bleedings and leeches. After being fired from his most recent job for speaking out on the matter, he ends up in the employ of Dr. Robert Dalrymple (Jonathan Pryce) who runs a private practice specializing in treating women who suffer from "hysteria" and come to the doctor for his precise digital manipulations in order to get a release. With the help of Mortimer's best friend Edmund (Rupert Everett) together they create a device that allows these women to achieve the desired result much more quickly. Complicating matters, Mortimer becomes enamored of Dalrymple's strong-willed, feminist-minded daughter Charlotte (Maggie Gyllenhaal). Hysteria played at the 2011 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Scoop
programme.desc: There's murder, magic, mystery and romance afoot as writer-director Woody Allen heads to London for this beguiling and riotous whodunit. Allen is a magician who's recruited by an American journalism student (Scarlett Johansson) to help solve a crime after a ghost (Ian McShane) tells her that a British aristocrat (Hugh Jackman), with whom she may be falling in love, might actually be a murderer known as "The Tarot Card Killer." Charles Dance, Romola Garai, Julian Glover, Sam Friend(n)

programme.title: Aloft
programme.desc: In this mystical and nonlinear drama, a mother reunites with her estranged son, whom she abandoned two decades earlier after a strange encounter with a faith healer(n)

programme.title: Seven Pounds
programme.desc: Will Smith stars in the emotional story of a man who changes the lives of seven strangers(n)

programme.title: The Great Raid
programme.desc: . In the waning days of World War II, General Douglas MacArthur chose to make good on a pledge that he made in 1942 -- that he would return to the Philippines after he and his troops were forced to retreat. However, MacArthur's determination was more than a matter of pride. Over 500 American soldiers were being held in Cabanatuan, a notoriously brutal prisoner of war camp in the Philippines operated by the Japanese army, and MacArthur wanted to see to it that they made it home(n)

programme.title: The Constant Gardener
programme.desc: Quiet diplomat Justin searches for answers when his activist wife is murdered in Kenya. Rachel Weisz won an Oscar for her remarkable performance in John Le Carré's thrilling murder mystery(n)

programme.title: Hysteria
programme.desc: Set in Victorian London, Tanya Wexler's period comedy Hysteria tells the tale of Mortimer Granville (Hugh Dancy), a young doctor disturbed by the way most hospitals ignore the latest research on germ theory, and still treat patients with bleedings and leeches. After being fired from his most recent job for speaking out on the matter, he ends up in the employ of Dr. Robert Dalrymple (Jonathan Pryce) who runs a private practice specializing in treating women who suffer from "hysteria" and come to the doctor for his precise digital manipulations in order to get a release. With the help of Mortimer's best friend Edmund (Rupert Everett) together they create a device that allows these women to achieve the desired result much more quickly. Complicating matters, Mortimer becomes enamored of Dalrymple's strong-willed, feminist-minded daughter Charlotte (Maggie Gyllenhaal). Hysteria played at the 2011 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Fathers and Daughters
programme.desc: Jake raises his daughter Katie on his own after his wife died in a fatal car accident and he suffered a mental breakdown. He struggles with the daily routines he has to go through to make sure she lives happily. His relatives intend to take Katie away from him but Jake knows that he has to hold on to the one thing that he loves the most - his daughter(n)

programme.title: Seven Pounds
programme.desc: Will Smith stars in the emotional story of a man who changes the lives of seven strangers(n)

programme.title: Brick
programme.desc: A student investigates a mysterious death in this noirish crime thriller(n)

programme.title: One More Time
programme.desc: In this touching drama, a musician reeling from personal and professional disappointments moves into the Hamptons home of her father, a Sinatra-esque crooner still hoping to make a career comeback. In time, father and daughter bond while seeking success in the music industry(n)

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: Kristin Stewart and Dakota Fanning star in Floria Sigismondi's rock biopic, based on Cherie Currie's autobiography. It's the mid-1970s and southern Californian teen Joan Larkin has changed her name to Joan Jett. Along with her new dark, edgy identity comes a nascent desire: to create an all-girl rock band. Joan and her aggressive manager Kim Fowley stumble across the perfect face for the band: 15-year-old blonde bombshell Cherie Currie. The two girls become close, with Cherie's sweet melodies slickly harmonising with Joan's electrifying guitar solos to great effect. They name themselves The Runaways and, after recruiting a lead guitarist and a bass player, are soon signed to Mercury Records, and plunged into the deep end of 70s rock excess. The success of their first album is massive. But, after a concert in Japan, the rest of the band discover magazines that feature only pictures of Cherie inside them - and are furious that they've been left out. Cherie begins to crumble under the pressures of being the face of the band, and finds solace in alcohol and drugs. As the band's stability disintegrates, can the girls rediscover the runaway rock and roll lifestyle they sought? Also starring Stella Maeve, Scout Taylor-Compton and Alia Shawkat(n)

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst is the French princess who just wants to have fun. Mix Oscar-winning costumes and tracks by The Strokes and Aphex Twin for a champagne cocktail with pop(n)

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: Elegant account of an English butler's professional and emotional life, examined retrospectively during a journey toward a reunion with the housekeeper he loved years before. He recalls his lengthy unquestioned service with a reactionary, pro-Nazi aristocrat, and his painfully unfulfilled relationship with the woman he is going to meet. Meticulous Merchant Ivory production based on Kazuo Ishiguro's novel(n)

programme.title: Jimmy's Hall
programme.desc: In this fascinating drama set in 1932 and based on actual events, Irish political activist Jimmy Gralton reopens a community hall in his hometown with the help of the locals. However, he faces opposition from both the government and a crotchety priest, who suspect the hall is a hotbed for loose morals and communist activity(n)

programme.title: Henry Poole Is Here
programme.desc: Henry Poole moves in to a house in his old neighbourhood, to spend what he believes are his remaining days alone. The discovery of a miracle by a nosy neighbour ruptures his solitude and restores his faith in life(n)

programme.title: Basquiat
programme.desc: Basquiat tells the story of the meteoric rise of youthful artist Jean-Michel Basquiat who starting out his career as a street artist(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in Sofia Coppola's Oscar-winning film as over-the-hill actor Bob Harris, who is lured to Tokyo to "act" in a whisky commercial in return for big money. In the hotel bar, he bumps into Charlotte, the wife of a successful photographer on assignment who has been left to her own devices. Two strangers in an "alien" city, they form a friendship which slips into tenderness as they recognise each other's vulnerability. By turn comic and touching, the duo turn in pitch-perfect performances in one of the best romantic dramas of recent years(n)

programme.title: Friends With Money
programme.desc: A single woman envies the security of her married friends, while they in turn dream of her freedom in this comedy drama. Olivia (Jennifer Aniston) is a single woman in her mid-thirties who feels she's reached a crossroads in her life. Unhappy with her career as a teacher, Olivia quits and takes a job as a maid until she sorts out her feelings. However, Olivia feels as if she could use some support, both personal and financial, from her best friends, all of whom at very least have more in the bank than she does. But that's not to say they don't have problems of their own. Christine (Catherine Keener) and her husband Patrick (Jason Isaacs) are screenwriters who have discovered that collaborating is more stress than they can deal with. Jane (Frances McDormand) is married to Aaron (Simon McBurney); they work together as designers, but while their professional relationship is cordial, they've become numb to one another as lovers and friends. And Franny (Joan Cusack) and Matt (Greg Germann) are a couple who comfortably support themselves and their children thanks to an inherited fortune; while their material needs are met, emotionally they can barely handle marriage and parenthood. Friends With Money was written and directed by Nicole Holofcener, who previously made the acclaimed independent features Walking and Talking and Lovely & Amazing(n)

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst is the French princess who just wants to have fun. Mix Oscar-winning costumes and tracks by The Strokes and Aphex Twin for a champagne cocktail with pop(n)

programme.title: The Family Fang
programme.desc: Siblings reunite at their childhood home after their parents, avant-garde artists who specialise in public comedy skits, go missing. They soon wonder if their parents are truly in trouble, or if their disappearance is their final stunt(n)

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: Kristin Stewart and Dakota Fanning star in Floria Sigismondi's rock biopic, based on Cherie Currie's autobiography. It's the mid-1970s and southern Californian teen Joan Larkin has changed her name to Joan Jett. Along with her new dark, edgy identity comes a nascent desire: to create an all-girl rock band. Joan and her aggressive manager Kim Fowley stumble across the perfect face for the band: 15-year-old blonde bombshell Cherie Currie. The two girls become close, with Cherie's sweet melodies slickly harmonising with Joan's electrifying guitar solos to great effect. They name themselves The Runaways and, after recruiting a lead guitarist and a bass player, are soon signed to Mercury Records, and plunged into the deep end of 70s rock excess. Cherie begins to crumble under the pressures of being the face of the band, and finds solace in alcohol and drugs. As the band's stability disintegrates, can the girls rediscover the runaway rock and roll lifestyle they sought? Also starring Stella Maeve, Scout Taylor-Compton and Alia Shawkat(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in Sofia Coppola's Oscar-winning film as over-the-hill actor Bob Harris, who is lured to Tokyo to "act" in a whisky commercial in return for big money. In the hotel bar, he bumps into Charlotte, the wife of a successful photographer on assignment who has been left to her own devices. Two strangers in an "alien" city, they form a friendship which slips into tenderness as they recognise each other's vulnerability. By turn comic and touching, the duo turn in pitch-perfect performances in one of the best romantic dramas of recent years(n)

programme.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: Terry Gilliam (Brazil, Twelve Monkeys, The Fisher King) directed this colorful, stylized, pseudo-psychedelic $21-million adaptation of the 1971 Hunter S. Thompson classic, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas: A Savage Journey into the Heart of the American Dream, about stoned sportswriter Raoul Duke, Thompson's alter ego, on a wild drug-crazed road trip, a paranoid plummet into the belly of the beast, with his pal, lawyer Oscar Zeta Acosta. Originally serialized in Rolling Stone (November 1971), the book catapulted Thompson headfirst toward the Kerouac-Mailer-Capote pantheon and jump-started the entire movement of "gonzo journalism." Carrying a suitcase of drugs, Raoul Duke (Johnny Depp with shaved pate) and his attorney Dr. Gonzo (Benicio Del Toro) drive a red convertible across the Mojave from L.A. to Vegas, where Duke has an assignment to cover the Mint 400 desert motorcycle race. As the drugs kick in, Duke ventures into voiceover, filling in the blank spots and narrative gaps. "This is not a good town for psychedelic drugs," says Duke, but even so, they consume vast quantities, eventually escalating to ether. Duke notes that with ether "you can actually watch yourself behaving this terrible way, but you can't control it." The two trash their hotel room, and Gonzo goes back to L.A. Thinking the hotel room holocaust will lead to an arrest, Duke begins a drive back to L.A., but after an odd encounter with a highway patrolman (Gary Busey) and a telephone conversation with Gonzo, he returns to Vegas to cover the District Attorney Convention on Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs in the glitzy Flamingo Hotel. This time the drugged-out duo trash their Flamingo room. The crazed carnival atmosphere segues into a carney casino, Bazooko's Circus, where a barker (Penn Jillette) spiels amid aerialists, clowns, and a rotating carousel bar. Gonzo worries over runaway teen Lucy (Christina Ricci), who paints portraits of Barbra Streisand. Soon the hallucinations begin: Duke sees Gonzo transmogrify into a demon with breasts on its back, and an acid vision of a Vegas bar features large legit lounge lizards (courtesy of monster makeup man Rob Bottin). Flashbacks depicting Duke's intro to the drug scene jump back to love-Haight relationships in San Francisco's Summer of Love. Cameos and guest stars include Mark Harmon, Cameron Diaz, Flea, Lyle Lovett, Harry Dean Stanton, Ellen Barkin, Tobey Maguire, and Hunter S. Thompson himself. The film features a Geffen Records soundtrack mixing rock of the period with Vegas lounge tunes. Over the years, various script adaptations came and went as did numerous talents; people connected with past efforts to film Thompson's book include Martin Scorsese, Jack Nicholson, Dan Aykroyd, John Belushi, and writer-director Alex Cox. Shown in competition at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: Chasing Amy
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Jason Lee are starting to make it as a comic strip creators but their friendship is threatened when Affleck falls head-over-heels for Joey Lauren Adams, who is gay. Kevin Smith, whose Clerks showed earlier, offers an engaging, amusing love story that carries an underlying seriousness about the pains of love(n)

programme.title: Love Is All You Need
programme.desc: A widowed Englishman working in Denmark and a Danish hairdresser who's been left by her husband forge a fragile romance during a trip to Italy to see their son and daughter get married. Philip (Pierce Brosnan) is a stern businessman who hates living in Denmark, and hasn't seen his son Patrick (Sebastian Jessen) in years. He's in a race to Patrick's wedding in Italy when he has a chance run-in with Ida (Trine Dyrholm) who's recovering from successful chemotherapy treatments when she learns that her husband Leif (Kim Bodnia) has been sleeping with a younger woman. Ida also happens to be the mother of Astrid (Molly Blixt Egelind), Patrick's beautiful bride-to-be. Though initially Philip and Ida appear to have nothing in common, their shared recognition that their children's union may be in trouble before the wedding bells have started to chime leads to an unexpected connection, and a second chance at happiness as they work to set things right. Directed by Susanne Bier (In a Better World, Serena)(n)

programme.title: Out to Sea
programme.desc: A pair of grumpy old men hit the high seas in this comedy. Small-time con man Charlie (Walter Matthau) fast-talks his considerably more straight-laced friend Herb (Jack Lemmon) into joining him for a luxury cruise on an ocean liner headed to the Bahamas. Charlie tells Herb that the trip is free and will be a good way to meet rich widows; both parts are true enough, but Herb doesn't know that Charlie has signed them on as dance hosts (hence the free tickets), and Herb isn't sure if he's ready for romance after the recent death of his wife. As the men struggle with the fact that Herb isn't much of a hoofer (and Charlie can't dance at all) under the strict tutelage of cruise director Godwyn (Brent Spiner), Charlie starts sweet-talking beautiful heiress Liz (Dyan Cannon), while Herb finds a soul mate in Vivian (Gloria DeHaven), who lost her husband not long ago. Out to Sea also stars Elaine Stritch, Hal Linden, Rue McClanahan, and Donald O'Connor, who pulled his dancing shoes out of mothballs for his role(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Steins
programme.desc: The competition heats up as a young man on the cusp of adulthood in Brentwood, CA, prepares for his upcoming bar mitzvah, and his father strives to outdo the gargantuan coming-of-age bash recently thrown by his number-one nemesis, in a madcap tale of Hebrew rivalry from actor-turned-director Scott Marshall. Benjamin Fiedler (Daryl Sabara) is about to become a man, though the prospect of reciting a language he doesn't even really know in front of a temple full of strangers is so daunting that it makes him wish he could just stay a boy and write the whole thing off. As if his personal peccadilloes weren't enough to rack Benjamin's nerves, his father, Adam (Jeremy Piven), and mother, Joanne (Jami Gertz), are determined to send Benjamin into the adult world in true style. Recently, Adam's rival agent, Arnie Stein (Larry Miller), threw down the gauntlet for his own son's bar mitzvah by hosting a no-holds-barred bash that made New Year's Eve in Times Square look like cake-and-coffee day at the retirement community, and ultra-competitive Adam is determined to prove that he can top that now-legendary party. When Adam's aging, hippy-dippy father, Irwin (Garry Marshall), rolls into town in a broken-down RV with his dizzy young girlfriend, Sandy (Daryl Hannah), however, it appears as if all of his plans to out-class Arnie Stein may have been for naught(n)

programme.title: We'll Never Have Paris
programme.desc: A man second-guesses his plans to propose to his girlfriend after a pretty co-worker hits on him. When his girlfriend flees to Paris, he follows her in a last-ditch effort to salvage their relationship(n)

programme.title: Army of One
programme.desc: An ex-con receives a message from God that he must head to Pakistan and bring Osama bin Laden to justice. However, his bizarre journey draws the attention of U.S. forces stationed in the Middle East, who are baffled and annoyed by his vigilante quest(n)

programme.title: Only the Lonely
programme.desc: A sentimental comedy reminiscent of the 1955 Academy Award-winner Marty, Chris Columbus' Only the Lonely stars John Candy as Danny Muldoon, a Chicago cop who is pushing 40 and still living at home with his domineering mother Rose (Maureen O'Hara). When Danny falls for meek Theresa Luna (Ally Sheedy), Rose is aghast, forcing him to choose between his own happiness or his mother's(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Humorist Dave Barry's comic novel is the basis for this frenetic romp, set in Miami. It's the story of a crazy group of people whose lives interconnect. Included: a Pulitzer Prize-winning columnist; a nasty industrialist; his put-upon wife; hit men; and a philosophical street person(n)

programme.title: Spanglish
programme.desc: A Mexican immigrant working as a maid for an affluent L.A. couple has to maintain control of her own daughter, who wants to assimilate(n)

programme.title: Army of One
programme.desc: An ex-con receives a message from God that he must head to Pakistan and bring Osama bin Laden to justice. However, his bizarre journey draws the attention of U.S. forces stationed in the Middle East, who are baffled and annoyed by his vigilante quest(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: A black comedy about a frustrated puppeteer who gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office(n)

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: The gang from Friday and Next Friday are back in this urban comedy, in which Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) have finally moved out of their respective parents' homes and gotten an apartment together. However, a bogus neighborhood Santa Claus (Rickey Smiley) decides to help Craig and Day-Day share the wealth by robbing their apartment, and when he rips off their stereo, he also makes off with their rent money, which was hidden in the speaker cabinets. Desperate to make rent and have some money for Christmas presents, Craig and Day-Day land jobs at a local strip mall, where their fathers, Mr. Jones (John Witherspoon) and Uncle Elroy (Don "D.C." Curry), have gone into business together running a barbecue joint. Craig and Day-Day are installed as security guards, and while Craig tries to make time with Donna (K.D. Aubert), a saleswoman at the Pimp N' Ho's Boutique, and keep things orderly at Holy Moly's Doughnut Shop, Day-Day attempts to transform himself into a master of crime-fighting, which causes a lot more problems than it solves. Friday After Next is the first feature film from director Marcus Raboy, who previously directed music videos for Sting, Li'l Kim, Staind, and Friday After Next star Ice Cube(n)

programme.title: Gridlock'd
programme.desc: This gritty urban comedy focuses on three heroin addicts, one of whom must be rushed to a hospital after an overdose. As the condition of Cookie remains to be foretold, the other two try desperately to get into a rehabilitation clinic but face a never-ending wall of red tape(n)

programme.title: Dysfunktional Family
programme.desc: Comedian Eddie Griffin delivers a set of his outrageous standup comedy and introduces his fans to the family who helped inspire his work in this documentary. In DysFunKtional Family, Griffin talks about race, sex, cats, dogs, slavery, terrorism, Michael Jackson, and several of the more eccentric members of his family during a sold-out live show. In between bits, Griffin takes us on a tour of his home town of Kansas City, where we get to meet his mother, who has a remarkable enthusiasm for corporal punishment; his uncle, who discusses his remarkable enthusiasm for pornography; and another uncle, who proved to be an invaluable help to Griffin's early career despite his drug habit and career as a pimp. DysFunKtional Family was directed by George Gallo, who previously worked with Griffin on the comedy Double Take(n)

programme.title: Ride
programme.desc: In this road comedy, NYC film school grad Leta (Melissa De Sousa) gets a job assisting music-vid director Bleau Kelly (Downtown Julie Brown), and a group of rappers, singers, starlets, and showbiz wannabes sign on for a video to be shot in Florida. The gang gets acquainted on a decaying bus as they travel down the East Coast, encountering barroom fights and other problems en route to the vid gig. Cameo by Snoop Doggy Dogg(n)

programme.title: We'll Never Have Paris
programme.desc: A man second-guesses his plans to propose to his girlfriend after a pretty co-worker hits on him. When his girlfriend flees to Paris, he follows her in a last-ditch effort to salvage their relationship(n)
